       DOS SUPERVISOR     IOINTER      I/O INTERRUPT HANDLER                                                  PAGE    93


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                   3577+*                                                                       01271028
                                   3578+*********************************************************************** 01272028
                                   3579+*                                                                     * 01273028
                                   3580+*        GENERAL FUNCTIONS                                     @DM02683 01274028
                                   3581+*                                                                     * 01275028
                                   3582+*        ALL I/O INTERRUPTIONS ARE HANDLED BY THIS CODE.              * 01276028
                                   3583+*        THE CHANNEL AND DEVICE STATUS ARE ANALYSED. IN CASE OF       * 01277028
                                   3584+*        CHANNEL ERRORS RAS IS ACTIVATED. IN CASE OF DEVICE ERRORS    * 01278028
                                   3585+*        AN ENTRY IS BUILT IN THE ERRORQUEUE AND ERP IS ACTIVATED     * 01279028
                                   3586+*                                                                     * 01280028
                                   3587+*        WHEN NO ERRORS ARE DETECTED (ANY MORE) THE CCB FOR THIS      * 01281028
                                   3588+*        I/O REQUEST IS POSTED COMPLETE AND THE REQUESTING TASK IS    * 01282028
                                   3589+*        TAKEN OUT OF THE WAIT STATE, IF NECESSARY.                   * 01283028
                                   3590+*                                                                     * 01284028
                                   3591+*                                                                     * 01285028
                                   3592+*        REGISTER USAGE                                               * 01286028
                                   3593+*                                                                     * 01287028
                                   3594+*        R1   POINTS TO CCB                                           * 01288028
                                   3595+*        R2   BEFORE PUB IS LOCATED:  'CUU' OF INTERRUPTING DEVICE    * 01289028
                                   3596+*             AFTER PUB IS LOCATED: POINTS TO ERBLOC                  * 01290028
                                   3597+*        R3   POINTS TO PUB                                           * 01291028
                                   3598+*        R4   POINTS TO CHANNELQUEUE ENTRY                            * 01292028
                                   3599+*        R6   EXIT ADDRESS                                            * 01293028
                                   3600+*        R9   BASE REGISTER                                           * 01294028
                                   3601+*        R10  POINTS TO PIB OF REQUESTING TASK                        * 01295028
                                   3602+*        R13  BASE REGISTER OF EXCP ROUTINE                   &D34RDFG* 01295534
                                   3603+*                                                                     * 01296028
                                   3604+*********************************************************************** 01297028

                                   4473+***************************************************************@D34SDAP 50008034
                                   4474+*                                                              @D34SDAP 50088034
                                   4475+*   FUNCTION      THE MAIN FUNCTION OF THE I/O ERROR PROCESSOR @D34SDAP 50128034
                                   4476+*                 IS TO RETRIEVE ALL THE INFORMATION WHICH IS  @D34SDAP 50168034
                                   4477+*                 NECESSARY FOR THE RESIDENT DISK ERROR RECVRY @D34SDAP 50208034
                                   4478+*                 OR THE TRANSIENT ERROR RECOVERY PROCEDURES   @D34SDAP 50288034
                                   4479+*                 TO SUCCESSFULLY RECOVER FROM THE ERROR.      @D34SDAP 50328034
                                   4480+*                 ALL THIS INFORMATION IS SAVED IN A SO CALLED @D34SDAP 50368034
                                   4481+*                 ERROR QUEUE ENTRY WHICH IS PART OF THE ERROR @D34SDAP 50408034
                                   4482+*                 BLOCK.                                       @D34SDAP 50488034
                                   4483+*                 DISK ERROR ENTRIES (EXCLUDING THE 2321) ARE  @D34SDAP 50528034
                                   4484+*                 SEPERATED BY OTHER ERROR QUEUE ENTRIES       @D34SDAP 50568034
                                   4485+*                 WITHIN THIS ERROR BLOCK.                     @D34SDAP 50608034
                                   4486+*                 THE I/O ERROR PROCESSOR IS SUBDIVIDED INTO   @D34SDAP 50688034
                                   4487+*                 THREE MAJOR PARTS:                           @D34SDAP 50728034
                                   4488+*                    1.   DEVICE NOT OPERATIONAL     PROCESSOR @D34SDAP 50768034
                                   4489+*                    2.   ABNORMAL CHANNEL STATUS    PROCESSOR @D34SDAP 50808034
                                   4490+*                    3.   UNIT CHECK                 PROCESSOR @D34SDAP 50888034
                                   4491+*                    IN ADDITION TO THESE MAJOR PARTS A SET OF @D34SDAP 50928034
                                   4492+*                    SUBROUTINES HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED.         @D34SDAP 50968034
                                   4493+*                       1.   ALLOCATE FREE ERROR QUEUE ENTRY   @D34SDAP 51048034
                                   4494+*                       2.   SET UP AN ERROR QUEUE ENTRY       @D34SDAP 51088034
                                   4495+*                       3.   FREE ALLOCATED ERROR QUEUE ENTRY  @D34SDAP 51128034
                                   4496+*                                                              @D34SDAP 51168034
                                   4497+*   ENTRY POINTS                                               @D34SDAP 51208034
                                   4498+*                                                              @D34SDAP 51288034
                                   4499+*                 INTENOP     DEVICE NOT OPERATIONAL           @D34SDAP 51328034
                                   4500+*                 INTERRCC    ABNORMAL CHANNEL STATUS          @D34SDAP 51368034
                                   4501+*                 INTTRANS                                     @DY11919 51388034
                                   4502+*                 INTERRUC    UNIT CHECK                       @D34SDAP 51408034
                                   4503+*                 INTOBR                                       @DY11919 51448034
                                   4504+*                                                              @D34SDAP 51488034
                                   4505+*   REGISTER INPUT                                             @D34SDAP 51528034
                                   4506+*                                                              @D34SDAP 51568034
                                   4507+*                 REGISTER  1     POINTER TO USERS CCB         @D34SDAP 51608034

                                   5075+***************************************************************@D34SDAP 79278034
                                   5076+*                                                              @D34SDAP 79318034
                                   5077+*                                                              @D34SDAP 79358034
                                   5078+*   FUNCTION      THIS ROUTINE IS EXCLUSIVLY USED TO ISSUE A   @D34SDAP 79438034
                                   5079+*                 SENSE COMMAND TO ANY DEVICE KNOWN TO THE     @D34SDAP 79478034
                                   5080+*                 DOS/VS SUPERVISOR.                           @D34SDAP 79518034
                                   5081+*                 THE ROUTINE ITSELF HAS BEEN SET UP AS A      @D34SDAP 79558034
                                   5082+*                 SYSTEM TASK AND IT IS ASSUMED THAT THIS      @D34SDAP 79638034
                                   5083+*                 'SNSTASK' HAS THE HIGHEST PRIORITY OF ALL    @D34SDAP 79678034
                                   5084+*                 EXISTING SYSTEM TASKS. THIS SYSTEM TASK      @D34SDAP 79718034
                                   5085+*                 WILL BE ACTIVATED WHENEVER AN UNIT CHECK     @D34SDAP 79758034
                                   5086+*                 IS ENCOUNTERED FOR A DEVICE FOR WHICH A      @D34SDAP 79838034
                                   5087+*                 PUB-ENTRY DOES EXIST. IN CASE THE SENSE      @D34SDAP 79878034
                                   5088+*                 COMMAND IS TERMINATED ABNORMALLY, IT WILL    @D34SDAP 79918034
                                   5089+*                 BE RETRIED THREE TIMES. THE ERROR IF THAN    @D34SDAP 79958034
                                   5090+*                 STILL EXISTING WILL CAUSE THE PUB TO BE      @D34SDAP 80038034
                                   5091+*                 FLAGGED IN ERROR AND THE PROGRAM TO BE       @D34SDAP 80078034
                                   5092+*                 CANCELED.                                    @D34SDAP 80118034
                                   5093+*                                                              @D34SDAP 80158034
                                   5094+*   ENTRY POINTS                                               @D34SDAP 80198034

       DOS SUPERVISOR             DISK ERROR RECOVERY ROUTINE                                                 PAGE   129


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09




                                   5286+************************************************************** @DL28754 01360034
                                   5287+*                                                            * @DL28754 01390034
                                   5288+*            RESIDENT ERROR RECOVERY PROCEDURE               * @DL28754 01490034
                                   5289+*                                                            * @DL28754 01510034
                                   5290+*FUNCTION                                                    * @DL28754 01570034
                                   5291+*   THE FUNCTION OF THE RESIDENT DASD ERPS IS TO ATTEMPT TO  * @DL28754 01650034
                                   5292+*   RECOVER FROM I/O ERRORS OCCURRING ON DIRECT ACCESS       * @DL28754 01660034
                                   5293+*   STORAGE DEVICES. IN MOST CASES IT WILL RETRY THE USERS   * @DL28754 01750034
                                   5294+*   CHANNEL PROGRAM A SPECIFIC NUMBER OF TIMES UNTIL THE     * @DL28754 01751034
                                   5295+*   ERROR IS EITHER CORRECTED OR THE RETRY COUNT IS EXHAUST- * @DL28754 01850034
                                   5296+*   ED.  WHEN THE RETRY COUNT IS EXHAUSTED, IT WILL CONSIDER * @DL28754 01870034
                                   5297+*   THE ERROR TO BE PERMANENT.                               * @DL28754 01890034
                                   5298+*                                                            * @DL28754 01910034
                                   5299+*   IN THE EVENT OF AN END OF CYLINDER, OR TRACK OVERFLOW,   * @DL28754 02050034
                                   5300+*   THE USER'S CCB IS APPROPRIATELY POSTED AND THE ERROR IS  * @DL28754 02060034
                                   5301+*   IGNORED.  THE SAME IS TRUE FOR A NO RECORD FOUND UNLESS  * @DL28754 02150034
                                   5302+*   THE USER HAS REQUESTED A RETRY.  IN THIS CASE A RETRY OF * @DL28754 02158034
                                   5303+*   TEN TIMES IS ATTEMPTED AND IF STILL NOT FOUND, THE ERP   * @DL28754 02250034
                                   5304+*   WILL EXIT TO THE MESSAGE WRITER.                         * @DL28754 02257034
                                   5305+*                                                            * @DL28754 02350034
                                   5306+*   IN THE EVENT OF A TRACK CONDITION CHECK, THE ERP WILL    * @DL28754 02360034
                                   5307+*   DETERMINE THE ADDRESS OF THE ALTERNATE TRACK AND SET UP  * @DL28754 02450034
                                   5308+*   TO SEEK TO THE ALTERNATE TRACK.  IF THE TRACK WAS AN     * @DL28754 02460034
                                   5309+*   ALTERNATE TRACK TO BEGIN WITH, THE ERP WILL DETERMINE    * @DL28754 02550034
                                   5310+*   THE ADDRESS OF THE ORIGINAL DEFECTIVE TRACK, INCREMENT   * @DL28754 02590034
                                   5311+*   THE HEAD ADDRESS BY ONE AND SEEK TO THAT LOCATION TO     * @DL28754 02630034
                                   5312+*   ALLOW THE USER CHANNEL PROGRAM TO CONTINUE.  IF AN END OF* @DL28754 02670034
                                   5313+*   CYLINDER WAS DETECTED DURING THIS OPERATION, THE USER'S  * @D34DDDK 02750034
                                   5314+*   CCB WILL BE PROPERLY POSTED.                             * @DL28754 02790034
                                   5315+*                                                            * @DL28754 02830034
                                   5316+*   IF A SEEK CHECK SHOULD OCCUR, THE ERP WILL ISSUE A RECAL-* @DL28754 02870034
                                   5317+*   IBRATE COMMAND TO THE DEVICE BEFORE RETRYING THE USER'S  * @DL28754 02950034
                                   5318+*   CHANNEL PROGRAM.                                         * @DL28754 02990034
                                   5319+*                                                            * @DL28754 03030034
                                   5320+*   THE 370 DASD ERPS CONTAIN TWO MAJOR EXCEPTIONS.  IF      * @DL29SOM 03150034
                                   5321+*   THERE IS TO BE LOGGING, THE RMSR LOGGING BIT IN THE PUB2 * @DL29SOM 03190034
                                   5322+*   WILL BE SET FOR CERTAIN TYPES OF ERRORS.  THIS WILL      * @DL29SOM 03230034
                                   5323+*   PROMPT THE RMSR TRANSIENTS TO LOG THE ERROR ON THE FIRST * @DL29SOM 03270034
                                   5324+*   OCCURRANCE OF THE ERROR. EQUIPMENT CHECKS, BUSOUT CHECKS * @DL29SOM 03350034
                                   5325+*   ENVIRONMENTAL DATA PRESENT, UNCORRECTABLE DATA CHECKS AND* @DL29SOM 03390034
                                   5326+*   OVERRUN WILL ALWAYS BE LOGGED FOR CURRENT 370 DEVICES.   * @DL29SOM 03430034
                                   5327+*                                                            * @DL29SOM 03470034
                                   5328+*   THE SECOND ADDITION IS THE PRESENCE OF THE ERROR CORR-   * @DL28754 03790034
                                   5329+*   ECTION FUNCTION.  THE ERROR CORRECTION FUNCTION WORKS BY * @DL28754 03830034
                                   5330+*   FIRST DETERMINING THE LOCATION OF THE ERROR IN THE RECORD* @DL28754 03870034
                                   5331+*   JUST READ.  THIS IS DONE BY TAKING THE NUMBER OF BYTES   * @DL28754 03950034
                                   5332+*   READ, WHICH IS SET IN THE SENSE, AND SUBTRACTING THE REAR* @DL28754 03990034
                                   5333+*   DISPLACEMENT, WHICH IS ALSO SET IN THE SENSE.  THE THREE * @DL28754 04030034
                                   5334+*   ECF BYTES ARE THEN EXCLUSIVE OR'ED WITH THAT LOCATION IN * @DL28754 04070034
                                   5335+*   THE DATA RECORD.  NOTE THAT THE ECF ROUTINE WILL LOOP    * @DL29SOM 04150034
                                   5336+*   THROUGH TO DO THIS ONE BYTE AT A TIME.  THIS IS TO TAKE  * @DL29SOM 04190034
                                   5337+*   INTO ACCOUNT ANY DATA CHAINED CCWS WHERE THE DATE AREAS  * @DL29SOM 04230034

       DOS SUPERVISOR             DISK ERROR RECOVERY ROUTINE                                                 PAGE   130


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                   5338+*   MAY BE SCATTERED AND ALSO TO ACCOUNT FOR DATA AREAS      * @DL29SOM 04270034
                                   5339+*   THAT SPAN NON-CONTIGUOUS PAGES WHEN THE USER IS EXECUTING* @DL29SOM 04350034
                                   5340+*   IN VIRTUAL MODE.                                         * @DL29SOM 04370034
                                   5341+*                                                            * @DL28754 04430034
                                   5342+*   NECESSARY CALCULATIONS ARE MADE FOR DATA CHAINED CCWS    * @DL28754 04470034
                                   5343+*   AND IMBEDDED TICS.                                       * @DL28754 04550034
                                   5344+*                                                            * @DL29SOM 04590034
                                   5345+*ENTRY POINTS                                                * @DL28754 04670034
                                   5346+*        DISKERR                                             * @DL28754 04750034
                                   5347+*                                                            * @DL28754 04790034
                                   5348+*INPUT                                                       * @DL28754 04830034
                                   5349+*   R1  - CONTAINS POINTER TO USER'S CCB                     * @DL28754 04870034
                                   5350+*   R2  - CONTAINS POINTER TO ERRQUE                         * @D34SDDK 04950034
                                   5351+*   R3  - CONTAINS POINTER TO PUB FOR ERROR DEVICE           * @DL28754 04990034
                                   5352+*   R4  - CONTAINS POINTER TO CHQADR                         * @D34DDDK 05010034
                                   5353+*   R6  - GENERAL EXIT ADDRESS                               * @DL28754 05030034
                                   5354+*                                                            * @DL28754 05070034
                                   5355+*OUTPUT                                                      * @DL28754 05150034
                                   5356+*   R1  - UNCHANGED                                          * @DL28754 05190034
                                   5357+*   R2  - UNCHANGED                                          * @DL28754 05230034
                                   5358+*   R3  - UNCHANGED                                          * @DM01435 05270034
                                   5359+*   R4  - UNCHANGED                                          * @D34DDDK 05310034
                                   5360+*   R6  - UNCHANGED                                          * @DL28754 05350034
                                   5361+*   P2DFLG    - X'40' IF ERROR IS TO BE LOGGED               * @DL28754 05390034
                                   5362+*                                                            * @DL28754 05430034
                                   5363+*EXTERNAL REFERENCES                                         * @DL28754 05470034
                                   5364+*        GETDADR  - SUBROUTINE TO CONVERT REAL ADDRESSES TO  * @DL28754 05550034
                                   5365+*                   VIRTUAL ADDRESSES IN CCWS                * @DL28754 05590034
                                   5366+*        RMSGETP2 - SUBROUTINE TO FIND PUB2 ADDRESS          * @DL28754 05630034
                                   5367+*        VIRTAD   - SUBROUTINE TO CONVERT REAL ADDRESSES TO  * @DL28754 05670034
                                   5368+*                   VIRTUAL ADDRESSES                        * @DL28754 05710034
                                   5369+*                                                            * @DL28754 05750034
                                   5370+*EXITS NORMAL                                                * @DL28754 05790034
                                   5371+*        (ALL EXITS VIA DSKEXIT ROUTINE)                     * @D34DDDK 05830034
                                   5372+*        IGNORE   - POST ERROR TO USER AND IGNORE            * @DL28754 05870034
                                   5373+*        INITRG   - RETRY USERS CHANNEL PROGRAM              * @DL28754 05910034
                                   5374+*        INTRTN   - SIMULATE INTERRUPT FOR USER ROUTINE      * @D34DDDK 05950034
                                   5375+*        EXTRAN1  - CALL MESSAGE WRITER OR ANOTHER ERP       * @D34DDDK 06070034
                                   5376+*                   TRANSIENT                                * @DL28754 06110034
                                   5377+*                                                            * @DL28754 06150034
                                   5378+*EXIT ERROR                                                  * @DL28754 06190034
                                   5379+*        EXTRAN1  - PERMANENT ERROR EXIT                     * @D34DDDK 06230034
                                   5380+*        RCVERR1  - ERROR DURING RECOVERY DUE TO INVALID     * @D34DDDK 06280034
                                   5381+*                   ADDRESS PASSED TO ERP                    * @DL28754 06460034
                                   5382+*                                                            * @DL28754 06470034
                                   5383+*TABLES/WORK AREAS                                           * @DL28754 06480034
                                   5384+*   ERRQ      - LAST ERROR QUEUE ENTRY.  CONTAINS INFORMATION* @DL28754 06490034
                                   5385+*               ABOUT THE NATURE OF THE ERROR                * @DL28754 06500034
                                   5386+*   PUB       - CONTAINS INFORMATION ABOUT THE DEVICE        * @DL28754 06750034
                                   5387+*   CCB       - CONTAINS INFORMATION ABOUT THE USER REQUEST  * @DL28754 06790034
                                   5388+*ATTRIBUTES                                                  * @DL28754 06830034
                                   5389+*        REUSABLE, PRIVILEGED, DISABLED                      * @DL28754 06870034
                                   5390+*                                                            * @DL28754 06910034
                                   5391+*NOTES                                                       * @DL28754 06950034
                                   5392+*        LINES HAVE BEEN RENUMBERED IN RELEASE 34            * @D34DDDK 06990034

004590 45E0 B2B2            012B2  5684+         BAL   RE,RMSGETP2             FIND PUB2 ADDRESS       @D34DDDK 23950234
                            00000  5685+         USING PUB2ADR,R8              ESTABL ADDRESSABILITY   @D34DDDK 23950334
004594 48E0 8014            00014  5686+         LH    RE,P23350CR+4           *                       @D34DDDK 23950434
004598 41EE 0001            00001  5687+         LA    RE,1(RE)                * INCREASE COUNTER BY 1 @D34DDDK 23950534
00459C 40E0 8014            00014  5688+         STH   RE,P23350CR+4           *                       @D34DDDK 23950634

                                   6854+*                                 FLAG SET IN ENTRY.                  * 14751929

                                   6864+*              6:               + TO CALLER WITH CC=0 IF THE          * 14759629

                                   7544+* THE FOLLOWING ROUTINE TESTS IF THERE IS ROOM TO INSERT       @DL29ZCJ 46613929
                                   7545+* MORE IDALS OR CCWS IN THE PTA/IDRA.  IF NO ROOM, IT EXITS    @DL29ZCJ 46614329
                                   7546+* TO BACKOUT.  IF OVERRUNNING THE CURRENT RLD POINTER PRODUCES @DL29ZCJ 46614729
                                   7547+* MORE ROOM, IT DOES SO, SETTING THE RLD SWITCH TO FORCE REREAD@DL29ZCJ 46614829
                                   7548+* OF THE LAST RLD BLOCK.  IF IDALS HAVE ALREADY BEEN GENERATED @DL29ZCJ 46615029
                                   7549+* FOR THIS CCW STRING, A TIC AROUND THEM IS GENERATED AND THE  @DL29ZCJ 46615129
                                   7550+* CONDITION CODE IS SET TO ZERO TO INDICATE THIS.  THE         @DL29ZCJ 46615529
                                   7551+* CONDITION CODE IS LOW IF MORE ROOM AVAILABLE WITHOUT RLD     @DL29ZCJ 46615929
                                   7552+* BUFFER RESET, AND HIGH IF RESET BUT NO IDALS PRESENT.        @DL29ZCJ 46616029

  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                   7711+*********************************************************************KR 51601628
                                   7712+*        THE FOLLOWING ROUTINE STARTS THE FETCH-REQUEST AT THAT      KR 51602428
                                   7713+*        POINT WHERE IT COULDN'T BE CONTINUED BECAUSE NO MORE PAGE   KR 51603228
                                   7714+*        FRAMES WERE AVAILABLE OR THE REQUESTUNG TASK HAS BEEN       KR 51604028
                                   7715+*        DEACTIVATED.                                                KR 51604828

       DOS SUPERVISOR     CCW-TRANSLATION                                                                     PAGE   181


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                   7741+**********************************************************************  00182834
                                   7742+**********************************************************************  00182934
                                   7743+*  *                                                             *   *  00183032
                                   7744+*  *              NEW CCW-TRANSLATE FUNCTION                     *   *  00183432
                                   7745+*  *                                                             *   *  00183832
                                   7746+*  *             F A S T  -  T R A N S L A T E                   *   *  00184232
                                   7747+*  *             =============================                   *   *  00184632
                                   7748+*  *                                                             *   *  00185032
                                   7749+**********************************************************************  00185432
                                   7750+*  *                                                             *   *  00185832
                                   7751+*  *  GENERAL FUNCTION:                                          *   *  00186232
                                   7752+*  *                                                             *   *  00186632
                                   7753+*  *     AN ATTEMPT IS MADE TO RE-USE SAVED COPIES OF ONCE       *   *  00187032
                                   7754+*  *     TRANSLATED VIRTUAL CHANNEL PROGRAMS AS MANY TIMES AS    *   *  00187432
                                   7755+*  *     POSSIBLE, RATHER THEN DOING THE SAME TRANSLATION PROCESS*   *  00187832
                                   7756+*  *     OVER AND OVER AGAIN.                                    *   *  00188232
                                   7757+*  *                                                             *   *  00188632
                                   7758+*  *     THE CAPABILITY OF 'REMEMBERING' PREVIOUS TRANSLATIONS   *   *  00189032
                                   7759+*  *     CONSISTS OF STORING AND RECOGNIZING CERTAIN DATA:       *   *  00189432
                                   7760+*  *       1) VIRTUAL CCB ADDRESS                                *   *  00189832
                                   7761+*  *       2) VIRTUAL CCB                                        *   *  00190232
                                   7762+*  *       3) VIRTUAL CCW-STRING                                 *   *  00190632
                                   7763+*  *     TOGETHER THESE THREE ITEMS CONSTITUTE THE SO-CALLED     *   *  00191032
                                   7764+*  *     'REPLICA'                                               *   *  00191432
                                   7765+*  *                                                             *   *  00191832
                                   7766+*  *     WHEN ONE OR MORE PROGRAMS ARE RUNNING IN VIRTUAL MODE,  *   *  00192232
                                   7767+*  *     VARIOUS REPLICA'S CAN BE AROUND AT THE SAME TIME IN     *   *  00192632
                                   7768+*  *     THE SYSTEM, TOGETHER WITH THEIR ASSOCIATED PRESERVED:   *   *  00193032
                                   7769+*  *       1) COPIED CCB                                         *   *  00193432
                                   7770+*  *       2) TRANSLATED CCW-STRING                              *   *  00193832
                                   7771+*  *       3) IDALS                                              *   *  00194232
                                   7772+*  *                                                             *   *  00194632
                                   7773+*  *     WHEN A TRANSLATION REQUEST IS HANDLED, FIRST THE TASK   *   *  00195032
                                   7774+*  *     CONTROL BLOCK IS INITIALIZED AND REGISTERS ARE SAVED.   *   *  00195432
                                   7775+*  *                                                             *   *  00200032
                                   7776+*  *     THEN CONTROL IS PASSED TO THE 'TESTREPL' RECOGNITION    *   *  00200632
                                   7777+*  *     ROUTINE - SO AS TO CHECK WHETHER WITH RESPECT TO        *   *  00201232
                                   7778+*  *     VIRTUAL CCB ADDRESS, CCB ITSELF, AND CCW-STRING,        *   *  00201832
                                   7779+*  *     A MATCHING REPLICA EXISTS.                              *   *  00202432
                                   7780+*  *                                                             *   *  00203032
                                   7781+*  *     IS SO, THEN THE CORRESPONDING SAVED CCB COPY IS MADE    *   *  00203632
                                   7782+*  *     AVAILABLE BY POINTING REG 1 TO IT, AND THE 'FASTTRNS'   *   *  00204232
                                   7783+*  *     ROUTINE IS EXECUTED  INSTEAD OF THE 'CCWTRANS' FULL     *   *  00204832
                                   7784+*  *     TRANSLATION PROCEDURE.                                  *   *  00205432
                                   7785+*  *     OTHERWISE, 'CCWTRANS' PERFORMS THE REGULAR TRANSLATION  *   *  00206032
                                   7786+*  *     AND MOREOVER A NEW REPLICA IS CREATED AS WELL AS A      *   *  00206632
                                   7787+*  *     'DIDAL'.  (FOR DISCUSSION OF DIDAL SEE BELOW.)          *   *  00207232
                                   7788+*  *                                                             *   *  00207832
                                   7789+*  *     THE KERNEL OF THE 'FASTTRNS' ROUTINE IS THE FIXING OF   *   *  00208432
                                   7790+*  *     PAGES CONTAINING DATA AREAS.                            *   *  00209032
                                   7791+*  *     NO SCANNING THRU THE CHANNEL PROGRAM IS NEEDED, SINCE   *   *  00209632
                                   7792+*  *     IN ADDITION TO THE REPLICA A LIST IS MAINTAINED THAT    *   *  00210232
                                   7793+*  *     HOLDS FIRSTLY THE VIRTUAL ADDRESSES THAT HAVE TO BE     *   *  00210832
                                   7794+*  *     TRANSLATED AND FIXED, AND SECONDLY THE POINTERS TO THE  *   *  00211432
                                   7795+*  *     LOCATIONS WHERE THE CORRESPONDING TRANSLATED ADDRESSES  *   *  00212032

       DOS SUPERVISOR     CCW-TRANSLATION                                                                     PAGE   182


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                   7796+*  *     SHOULD BE MOVED INTO.                                   *   *  00212632
                                   7797+*  *                                                             *   *  00213232
                                   7798+*  *     THIS LIST, AS A KIND OF 'DOUBLEWORD-IDAL', IS CALLED    *   *  00213832
                                   7799+*  *     'DIDAL'.                                                *   *  00214432
                                   7800+*  *     THE DIDAL ENTRIES HAVE THE FOLLOWING FORMAT:            *   *  00215032
                                   7801+*  *                                                             *   *  00215632
                                   7802+*  *       --------------------------------------------------    *   *  00216232
                                   7803+*  *                VIRTUAL        X'01'   POINTER TO        *   *  00216832
                                   7804+*  *                ADDRESS        X'80'    LOCATION         *   *  00217432
                                   7805+*  *       --------------------------------------------------    *   *  00218032
                                   7806+*  *          0                 3      4                  7      *   *  00218632
                                   7807+*  *                                                             *   *  00219232
                                   7808+*  *     BIT 0 OF BYTE 4 IS USED AS A FLAG FOR THOSE ENTRIES     *   *  00219832
                                   7809+*  *     WHICH REQUIRE NO FIXING AS THE VIRTUAL ADDRESS IS       *   *  00220432
                                   7810+*  *     WITHIN A PAGE THAT IS ALREADY FIXED.                    *   *  00221032
                                   7811+*  *     THIS FLAG IS SET ONCE, WHEN THE DIDAL IS CREATED, AND   *   *  00221632
                                   7812+*  *     IS NEVER RESET.                                         *   *  00222232
                                   7813+*  *                                                             *   *  00222832
                                   7814+*  *     BIT 7 OF BYTE 4 IS SET EACH TIME THE CORRESPONDING PAGE *   *  00223432
                                   7815+*  *     IS FIXED ('FIXAREA' INITIALLY, LATER 'FASTTRNS') AND IT *   *  00224032
                                   7816+*  *     IS RESET WHEN THE PAGE IS FREED AGAIN ('UNFIX').        *   *  00224632
                                   7817+*  *                                                             *   *  00225232
                                   7818+*  *     CREATION OF THE DIDAL TAKES PLACE DYNAMICALLY UNDER     *   *  00225832
                                   7819+*  *     THE REGULAR CCW-TRANSLATION. FOR THIS PURPOSE THE       *   *  00226432
                                   7820+*  *     'FIXAREA' ROUTINE HAD TO BE MODIFIED: ADDITIONAL        *   *  00227032
                                   7821+*  *     FUNCTION IS THE CREATION OF ONE DIDAL ENTRY EACH TIME   *   *  00227632
                                   7822+*  *     THE 'FIXAREA' ROUTINE IS CALLED.                        *   *  00228232
                                   7823+*  *                                                             *   *  00228832
                                   7824+*  *     THE FUNCTION REFLECTS ALSO WHAT IS CALLED THE 'EXTENDED *   *  00229432
                                   7825+*  *     FAST-TRANSLATE'.                                        *   *  00230032
                                   7826+*  *     THIS MEANS THAT THAT AT RE-TRANSLATION TIME THE         *   *  00230632
                                   7827+*  *     FIXED DATA AREA PAGES ARE NOT IMMEDIATELY FREED,        *   *  00231232
                                   7828+*  *     BUT ARE KEPT FIXED ACROSS TRANSLATIONS AS LONG AS THE   *   *  00231832
                                   7829+*  *     PAGING RATE IS NOT SERIOUSLY IMPACTED.                  *   *  00232432
                                   7830+*  *                                                             *   *  00233032
                                   7831+*  *     A FEEDBACK MECHANISM IS PROVIDED FOR REGULATING THE     *   *  00233632
                                   7832+*  *     NUMBER OF TRANSLATED CHANNEL PROGRAMS THAT HAVE THEIR   *   *  00234232
                                   7833+*  *     DATA AREA PAGES FIXED, DEPENDING ON THE PAGING RATE.    *   *  00234832
                                   7834+*  *     THIS NUMBER CAN VARY FROM 0 UP TO 100 PERCENT           *   *  00235432
                                   7835+*  *     OF THE TOTAL NUMBER OF PRESERVED COPIES AT EACH MOMENT. *   *  00236032
                                   7836+*  *     WHEN NECESSARY PAGE 'UNFIX'ING IS DONE: ALWAYS FOR THE  *   *  00236632
                                   7837+*  *     LEAST RECENTLY USED COPY.                               *   *  00237232
                                   7838+*  *                                                             *   *  00237832
                                   7839+*  *     THERE ARE THREE MECHANISMS - TWO AT SYSTEM LEVEL AND    *   *  00238432
                                   7840+*  *     ONE AT PARTITION LEVEL - FOR DELETING 'OUT-OF-DATE'     *   *  00239032
                                   7841+*  *     COPIES TOGETHER WITH THEIR ASSOCIATED CCW-STRING AND    *   *  00239632
                                   7842+*  *     REPLICA, AS WELL AS IDAL AND DIDAL IF THERE ARE ANY.    *   *  00240232
                                   7843+*  *                                                             *   *  00240832
                                   7844+*  *     THUS A TRANSLATION REQUEST CAN BE HANDLED IN THREE      *   *  00241432
                                   7845+*  *     DIFFERENT WAYS, DEPENDENT ON WHETHER A MATCHING REPLICA *   *  00242032
                                   7846+*  *     EXISTS OR NOT, AND IN CASE OF A MATCHING REPLICA        *   *  00242632
                                   7847+*  *     ON WHETHER THE DATA ARE PAGES ARE STILL FIXED OR NOT:   *   *  00243232
                                   7848+*  *       1) FULL-TRANSLATION  (CCWTRANS)                       *   *  00243832
                                   7849+*  *       2) FAST-TRANSLATION  (FASTTRNS)                       *   *  00244432
                                   7850+*  *       3) NULL-TRANSLATION  (FASTTRNS, SHORT PATH)           *   *  00245032

       DOS SUPERVISOR     CCW-TRANSLATION                                                                     PAGE   183


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                   7851+*  *                                                             *   *  00245632
                                   7852+*  *     FULL-TRANSLATION INCLUDES REPLICA - AND DIDAL CREATION  *   *  00246232
                                   7853+*  *     WITH TWO EXCEPTIONS:                                    *   *  00246832
                                   7854+*  *       1) REQUEST IS FROM BTAM                               *   *  00247432
                                   7855+*  *       2) CCW-STRING IS NOT CONTIGOUS                        *   *  00248032
                                   7856+*  *     THESE TWO CASES ARE NOT SUPPORTED BY FAST-TRANSLATE.    *   *  00248632
                                   7857+*  *                                                             *   *  00249232
                                   7858+*  *     AFTER THE REPLICA AND DIDAL HAVE BEEN CREATED THE       *   *  00249832
                                   7859+*  *     FASTTR-BIT IN THE CCBFLAG (OF THE COPIED CCB) IS SET    *   *  00250432
                                   7860+*  *     TO SHOW THAT THE CCB IS SUPPORTED BY FAST-TRANSLATE.    *   *  00251032
                                   7861+*  *                                                             *   *  00251632
                                   7862+*  *  ENTRY POINTS:                                              *   *  00252232
                                   7863+*  *     CCWTRANS - FROM CHANNEL SCHEDULER (NORMAL)              *   *  00252832
                                   7864+*  *     CCWTRBT2 - FROM I/O INT. HANDLER FOR BTAM 2ND TIME      *   *  00253432
                                   7865+*  *                                                             *   *  00254032
                                   7866+*  *  INPUT:                                                     *   *  00254632
                                   7867+*  *     R1 -  POINTS TO VIRTUAL CCB                             *   *  00255232
                                   7868+*  *     R8 -  RETURN ADDRESS                                    *   *  00255832
                                   7869+*  *     R9 -  FIRST BASE ADDRESS                                *   *  00256432
                                   7870+*  *                                                             *   *  00257032
                                   7871+*  *  OUTPUT:                                                    *   *  00257632
                                   7872+*  *     R1 -  POINTS TO COPIED CCB                              *   *  00258232
                                   7873+*  *     R8 -  UNCHANGED                                         *   *  00258832
                                   7874+*  *     R9 -  UNCHANGED                                         *   *  00259432
                                   7875+*  *                                                             *   *  00260032
                                   7876+*  *  EXTERNAL REFERENCES:                                       *   *  00260632
                                   7877+*  *     TFIX    - ROUTINE TO FIX A PAGE                         *   *  00261232
                                   7878+*  *     TFREE   - ROUTINE TO FREE A PAGE                        *   *  00261832
                                   7879+*  *     RWAIT   - ROUTINE TO GO INTO WAIT STATUS                *   *  00262432
                                   7880+*  *                                                             *   *  00263032
                                   7881+*  *  EXITS NORMAL:                                              *   *  00263632
                                   7882+*  *     RETURN ADDRESS IN R8                                    *   *  00264232
                                   7883+*  *                                                             *   *  00264832
                                   7884+*  *  EXITS ERROR:                                               *   *  00265432
                                   7885+*  *     ERR11   - UNSUPPORTED DEVICE                            *   *  00266032
                                   7886+*  *     ERR12   - INSUFFICIENT BUFFER SPACE                     *   *  00266632
                                   7887+*  *     ERR13   - LENGTH OF I/O AREA > 32K                      *   *  00267232
                                   7888+*  *     ERR14   - PAGE POOL TOO SMALL                           *   *  00267832
                                   7889+*  *     ERR25   - INVALID ADDRESS                               *   *  00268432
                                   7890+*  *     CCWTERR - NOT ENOUGH COPY BUFFERS FOR BTAM 2ND TIME     *   *  00269032
                                   7891+*  *               TRANSLATION, OR                               *   *  00269632
                                   7892+*  *             - CORFIXIN SUBROUTINE FINDS PAGE THAT IS TO     *   *  00270232
                                   7893+*  *               BE FREED IS NOT IN CORE                       *   *  00270832
                                   7894+*  *                                                             *   *  00271432
                                   7895+*  *  SUBROUTINES:                                               *   *  00272032
                                   7896+*  *     GETTCB, GETBLOCK, GETCCW, SETFLAG, TESTIDAL, LOCATE,    *   *  00272632
                                   7897+*  *     FIXAREA, DISPLRTN, UNFIX, FREE0, RELTCB, RELBLOCK,      *   *  00273232
                                   7898+*  *     CORFIXIN, RELCCB, RELALL, CCWRSVC, SETBACK, DELENT,     *   *  00273832
                                   7899+*  *     CCBMOVE, CCWDEACT, FASTTRNS, CREATREP, TESTREPL,        *   *  00274432
                                   7900+*  *     DELREPL, FREECCB, DEFIC, PACKDDAL, ENQTOP, DEQUEU       *   *  00275032
                                   7901+*  *                                                             *   *  00275632
                                   7902+*  *  TABLES:                                                    *   *  00276232
                                   7903+*  *     DEVTRTAB  - TRANSLATE TABLE FOR DEVICE TYPE             *   *  00276832
                                   7904+*  *     DEVLIST   - LIST POINTS                                 *   *  00277432
                                   7905+*  *     DEVL1ST   - TABLE FOR TP STATUS MODIFIER COMMANDS       *   *  00278032

       DOS SUPERVISOR     CCW-TRANSLATION                                                                     PAGE   184


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                   7906+*  *     DEVL2ST   - TABLE FOR DASD STATUS MODIFIER COMMANDS     *   *  00278632
                                   7907+*  *     DEVLXCD   - (X=1,2,...9,) CONTROL COMMANDS WITH DATA    *   *  00279232
                                   7908+*  *     FREETKT   - TRANSL. AND TEST TABLE FOR FIXINF BITSTRING *   *  00279832
                                   7909+*  *     RQHDRT    - REPLICA QUEUE HEADER TABLE (FAST-TRANSLATE) *   *  00280432
                                   7910+*  *               - CONTAINING QUEUE HEADERS BY PARTITION.      *   *  00281032
                                   7911+*  *               - THIS TABLE IS ACCESSED FROM 'RQBASE' AS     *   *  00281632
                                   7912+*  *               - THE ABSOLUTE BASE WITH PIK/4 AS AN INDEX.   *   *  00282232
                                   7913+*  *                                                             *   *  00282832
                                   7914+*  *  REGISTER CHANGED:                                          *   *  00283432
                                   7915+*  *     R1                                                      *   *  00284032
                                   7916+*  *                                                             *   *  00284632
                                   7917+*  *  NOTES:                                                     *   *  00285232
                                   7918+*  *  1. SINCE FAST-TRANSLATE SUPPORT GIVES AN INCREASE OF ABOUT *   *  00285832
                                   7919+*  *     1.2K BYTES, A SECOND BASE REGISTER HAD TO BE ADDED:     *   *  00286432
                                   7920+*  *     R9         - 1ST BASE REGISTER, AS USED ALREADY         *   *  00287032
                                   7921+*  *     RB         - 2ND BASE REGISTER, ADDED                   *   *  00300032
                                   7922+*  *  2. IN LOWCORE 3 NEW FIELDS:                                *   *  00300232
                                   7923+*  *     A) ACCWT2   - SECOND BASE ADDRESS (4 BYTES)             *   *  00300432
                                   7924+*  *     B) DEFIXSW  - SWITCH FOR DEFIX-RT. (1 BYTE)             *   *  00300632
                                   7925+*  *     C) LOWFXPTR - PTR USED BY DEFIX-RTN'S. (2 BYTES)        *   *  00300832
                                   7926+*  *  3. TASK CONTROL BLOCK HAS NOW 132 INSTEAD OF 112 BYTES.    *   *  00301032
                                   7927+*  *  4. CCB COPY HAS 2 FORMATS NOW, DEPENDING ON WHICH QUEUE    *   *  00301232
                                   7928+*  *     IT RESIDES: ACTIVE/SAVED-CCB-COPY-BLOCK-Q (SEE DSECT)   *   *  00301432
                                   7929+*  *                                                             *   *  00301632
                                   7930+*  *                                                             *   *  00301832
                                   7931+**********************************************************************  00302032
                                   7932+**********************************************************************  00303032



                            06C80  7934+CCWTADR  EQU   *                                                        01250028



                                   7936+*****    BUFFER MANAGEMENT INFORMATION *****                            02350028

                                   7938+*        ACCBB HAS TO HAVE OFFSET 0 FROM CCWTADR THIS                   02410028
                                   7939+*        IS USED BY 'STAND ALONE DUMP'                                  02420028

       DOS SUPERVISOR      CCW-TRANSLATION  CCWTRANS ROUTINE                                                  PAGE   186


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                   7968+*        GENERAL FUNCTIONS                                              07950028
                                   7969+*        BUILDING REAL CCB AND CHANNEL PROGRAM FROM NONREAL I/O REQ.    08000028
                                   7970+*        CCB AND USER SENSE CCW WILL BE COPIED.THE COPY WILL CONSERVE   08050028
                                   7971+*        THE CHANNEL PROGR.STRUCTURE,BUT IN SOME CASES TIC COMMANDS     08100028
                                   7972+*        WILL BE INSERTED.THE I/O ADDRESS IN A NONREAL PARTITION WILL   08150028
                                   7973+*        BE TRANSLATED INTO CORRESPONDING REAL ADDRESS.AN IDAL WILL BE  08200028
                                   7974+*        BUILD IF AN I/O AREA CROSSES PAGE BOUNDERY.THE IDAL WILL CONT. 08250028
                                   7975+*        THE REAL ADDRESS OF THE I/O AREA.IN THE COPIED CHANNEL PROGRAM 08300028
                                   7976+*        THE IDAL ADDRESS WILL BE REPLACED BY THE VIRTUAL ADDRESS AND   08350028
                                   7977+*        THE IDAL BIT IN THE SAME CCW WILL BE TURNED ON,IF THE VIRTUAL  08400028
                                   7978+*        CHANNEL PROGRAM ALREADY USES IDAL FEATURE.ALL I/O AREAS NEEDED 08450028
                                   7979+*        BY THE CHANNEL PROGRAM HAVE TO BE IN REAL MEMORY UNTIL I/O     08500028
                                   7980+*        REQUEST IS FINISHED(PAGES ARE FIXED AND NO PAGE FAULT WILL     08550028
                                   7981+*        EXISTS)IN THE COPIED CCB THE ADDRESS OF THE VIRTUAL CHANNEL    08600028
                                   7982+*        PROGRAM WILL BE REPLACED BY THE ADDRESS OF COPIED CHANNEL PRGR 08650028
                                   7983+*        ALL DOS I/O SV ROUTINES WILL WORK ON THE COPY.                 08700028
                                   7984+*                                                                       08750028
                                   7985+*        CCWTRANS WILL BE CALLED FROM  CHANNEL SCHEDULER(EXCP)          08800028
                                   7986+*        AND WILL CALL                 GETTCB,GETBLOCK,TESTIDAL,GETCCW  08850028
                                   7987+*                                      LOCATE,FIXAREA,RWAIT,RELALL      08900028
                                   7988+*                                      RELTCB                           08950028



                            06C80  7990+         USING CCWTADR,R9                                      @D32XDRP 09050032
                                   7991+         DROP  RB                  DROP STANDARD SYTEM BASE    @D34RDFG 09051034



                                   7993+*                                                                       09054028
                                   7994+*        ENTRY FROM I/O INTERRUPT HANDL. FOR BTAM 2ND TIME              09058028

                                   8046+*                                  RESTAR.AFTER IT WAS SET BACK@D32XDRP 11000232

006EB6 9280 4038      00038        8075+         MVI   TIC1,EOCL .         INITIALIZE                           12350028

                                   8544+*        PARAMETER: REG 5 POINTS TO A FULLWORD. THE LAST THREE BYTES    39500028
                                   8545+*                      CONTAIN A VIRTUAL ADDRESS.                       39550028
                                   8546+*                   REG F POINTS TO CCWTCB                              39600028
                                   8547+*                   REG 3 RETURN ADDRESS                                39650028
                                   8548+*        FUNCTION:  IT WILL FIX THE REAL PAGE FRAME CORRESPONDING TO    39700028
                                   8549+*                   THE VIRTUAL ADDR.AND THEN REPLACE VIRTUAL BY REAL   39750028
                                   8550+*                   ADDR.TEMPORARY FIXING WILL BE DONE BY TFIX ROUTINE  39800028

       DOS SUPERVISOR         CCW TRANSLATION  UNFIX ROUTINE                                                  PAGE   205


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                   8667+************************************************************** @D32XDRP 43300332
                                   8668+*                                                              @D32XDRP 43300632
                                   8669+*      UNFIX ROUTINE                                           @D32XDRP 43301032
                                   8670+*                                                              @D32XDRP 43301232
                                   8671+************************************************************** @D32XDRP 43301432
                                   8672+*                                                              @D32XDRP 43301632
                                   8673+*    FUNCTION:                                                 @D32XDRP 43302032
                                   8674+*        FIXED DATA ARE PAGES, IF ANY, ARE FREED.              @D32XDRP 43312032
                                   8675+*        IF FASTTR AND SAVEDQ-BIT IN CCBFLAG IS OFF, THEN THE  @DM12800 43322032
                                   8676+*        FIXINF BITSTRING IS USED AND THE BITS ARE RESET.      @D32XDRP 43332032
                                   8677+*        OTHERWISE, THE DIDAL ENTRIES ARE SCANNED AND THE      @D32XDRP 43342032
                                   8678+*        SUCCESSIVE PAGES ARE FREED IF THE NOWFXD-BIT IS ON.   @D32XDRP 43352032
                                   8679+*        RIGHT AFTER EACH PAGE-FREEING THE NOWFXD-BIT IN THE   @D32XDRP 43362032
                                   8680+*        CORRESPONDING DIDAL-ENTRY IS RESET.                   @D32XDRP 43372032
                                   8681+*        FINALLY THE FXREQD-BIT IN THE CCBFLAG IS TURNED ON.   @D32XDRP 43382032
                                   8682+*    ENTRY POINTS:                                             @D32XDRP 43392032
                                   8683+*        UNFIX  -FROM CSWTRANS,DEFIX,DELREPL,DEFIXALL,DEFIXCON @D32XDRP 43402032
                                   8684+*    INPUT:                                                    @D32XDRP 43412032
                                   8685+*        R1 - POINTS TO COPIED CCB                             @D32XDRP 43422032
                                   8686+*        RD - RETURN ADDRESS                                   @D32XDRP 43432032
                                   8687+*        R9 - FIRST BASE ADDRESS                               @D32XDRP 43442032
                                   8688+*        RB - SECOND BASE ADDRESS                              @D32XDRP 43452032
                                   8689+*    OUTPUT:                                                   @D32XDRP 43462032
                                   8690+*        R1 - UNCHANGED                                        @D32XDRP 43472032
                                   8691+*        RD - UNCHANGED                                        @D32XDRP 43482032
                                   8692+*        R9 - UNCHANGED                                        @D32XDRP 43492032
                                   8693+*        RB - UNCHANGED                                        @D32XDRP 43502032
                                   8694+*    EXTERNAL REFERENCES:                                      @D32XDRP 43512032
                                   8695+*        TFREE   - ROUTINE TO FREE A PAGE                      @D32XDRP 43522032
                                   8696+*    EXITS NORMAL:                                             @D32XDRP 43532032
                                   8697+*        RETURN ADDRESS IN RD                                  @D32XDRP 43542032
                                   8698+*    EXITS ERROR:                                              @D32XDRP 43552032
                                   8699+*        NONE                                                  @D32XDRP 43562032
                                   8700+*    SUBROUTINES:                                              @D32XDRP 43572032
                                   8701+*        FREED  (IF FASTTR-BIT OFF)                            @D32XDRP 43582032
                                   8702+*    REGISTERS CHANGED:                                        @D32XDRP 43592032
                                   8703+*    A. FASTTR AND SAVEDQ-BIT 0- R2,R3,R4,R5,R6,R7,R8,RC,RE    @DM12800 43602032
                                   8704+*    B. FASTTR OR  SAVEDQ-BIT 1- R3,R4,R5,RC,RE                @DM12800 43612032
                                   8705+*                                                              @D32XDRP 43622032
                                   8706+************************************************************** @D32XDRP 43632032
                            0750C  8707+UNFIX    EQU   *                                                        43650028
00750C 9142 101A      0001A        8708+         TM    CCBFLAG,TTFIX+FXREQD ARE THERE ANY PAGES TO BE  @D32XDRP 43700032
                                   8709+*                                  FREED?                      @D32XDRP 43710032
007510 07BD                        8710+         BCR   NM,RD               NO, RETURN                  @D32XDRP 43720032
007512 4830 0928            00928  8711+         LH    R3,CNTCOM .         DECREASE NUMBER                      43900028
007516 0630                        8712+         BCTR  R3,R0 .             OF COMPLETED TRANSLATIONS            43950028
007518 4030 0928            00928  8713+         STH   R3,CNTCOM .         WITH PAGES FIXED                     44000028
                            0751C  8714+UNFIX0   EQU   *                                                        44050028
00751C 910C 101A      0001A        8715+         TM    CCBFLAG,FASTTR+SAVEDQ   FAST-TRANS?             @D32XDRP 44060032
007520 4770 98E6      07566        8716+         BNZ   UNFIX3              DO IT THE FAST-WAY          @D32XDRP 44080032
007524 1881                        8717+         LR    R8,R1 .             SAVE R1                              44100028
                            00000  8718+         USING CCBADR,R8                                                44150028

       DOS SUPERVISOR      CCW TRANSLATION  CSWTRANS ROUTINE                                                  PAGE   218


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                   9119+***************************************************************@D32XDRP 58100032
                                   9120+************************************************************** @D32XDRP 58106032
                                   9121+* *                                                            @D32XDRP 58112032
                                   9122+* *                CCW - BACKTRANSLATION                       @D32XDRP 58118032
                                   9123+* *                                                            @D32XDRP 58124032
                                   9124+************************************************************** @D32XDRP 58130032
                                   9125+* *                                                            @D32XDRP 58136032
                                   9126+* *  GENERAL FUNCTION:                                         @D32XDRP 58142032
                                   9127+* *                                                            @D32XDRP 58148032
                                   9128+* *      THE FUNCTION DEPENDS ON WHETER THE FASTTR-BIT IN THE  @D32XDRP 58154032
                                   9129+* *      CCB-FLAG (OF THE COPIED CCB) IS 'ON' OR 'OFF'.        @D32XDRP 58160032
                                   9130+* *                                                            @D32XDRP 58166032
                                   9131+* *      IF THE TRANSLATION WAS NOT SUPPORTED BY FAST-TRANSLATE@D32XDRP 58172032
                                   9132+* *      THEN THE REGULAR RETRANSLATION IS PERFORMED INCLUDING @D32XDRP 58178032
                                   9133+* *      THE FREEING OF DATA AREA PAGES AND THE RELEASE OF ALL @D32XDRP 58184032
                                   9134+* *      OCCUPIED COPY BLOCKS.                                 @D32XDRP 58190032
                                   9135+* *                                                            @D32XDRP 58196032
                                   9136+* *      IN CASE OF SUPPORT BY FAST-TRANSLATE THE RETRANSLATION@D32XDRP 58202032
                                   9137+* *      IS DONE IN THE REGULAR WAY, BUT WHAT IS BYPASSED IS   @D32XDRP 58208032
                                   9138+* *      THE FREEING OF PAGES AND RELEASING COPY BLOCKS.       @D32XDRP 58214032
                                   9139+* *      THE CCB-COPY BLOCK IS ENQUEUED IN THE SAVED-CCB-COPY- @D32XDRP 58220032
                                   9140+* *      BLOCK-QUEUE INSTEAD, AND THE DEFIX-SWITCH IN THE      @D32XDRP 58226032
                                   9141+* *      SYSCOM IS TESTED.                                     @D32XDRP 58232032
                                   9142+* *                                                            @D32XDRP 58238032
                                   9143+* *      IF DEFIXSW=1, THIS MEANS THAT THE PAGING RATE IS IN   @D32XDRP 58244032
                                   9144+* *      THE DANGEROUS ZONE BEFORE THE LOAD LEVELER STARTS     @D32XDRP 58250032
                                   9145+* *      TRYING TO DEACTIVATE A PARTITION, THE DEFIX ROUTINE   @D32XDRP 58256032
                                   9146+* *      IS CALLED FOR THE LEAST RECENTLY USED CCB THAT IS     @D32XDRP 58262032
                                   9147+* *      KEPT AND THAT HAS STILL ITS ASSOCIATED DATA AREA      @D32XDRP 58268032
                                   9148+* *      PAGES FIXED.                                          @D32XDRP 58274032
                                   9149+* *      DEFIX WILL FREE THE DATA AREA PAGES ASSOCIATED WITH   @D32XDRP 58280032
                                   9150+* *      THE CCB POINTED TO BY LOWFXPTR AND WILL ALSO UPDATE   @D32XDRP 58286032
                                   9151+* *      LOWFXPTR SUCH THAT IT POINTS TO THE NEXT HIGHER       @D32XDRP 58292032
                                   9152+* *      ELEMENT IN THE SAVED-CCB-COPY-BLOCK-QUEUE.            @D32XDRP 58298032
                                   9153+* *                                                            @D32XDRP 58304032
                                   9154+* *  ENTRY POINTS:                                             @D32XDRP 58310032
                                   9155+* *      CSWTRANS - FROM I/O INTERRUPT HANDLER                 @D32XDRP 58316032
                                   9156+* *                                                            @D32XDRP 58322032
                                   9157+* *  INPUT:                                                    @D32XDRP 58328032
                                   9158+* *      R1 - POINTS TO COPIED CCB                             @D32XDRP 58334032
                                   9159+* *      R8 - RETURN ADDRESS                                   @D32XDRP 58340032
                                   9160+* *      RA - POINTS TO PIB OF REQUESTOR                       @D32XDRP 58346032
                                   9161+* *      R9 - FIRST BASE ADDRESS                               @D32XDRP 58352032
                                   9162+* *      RB - SECOND BASE ADDRESS                              @D32XDRP 58358032
                                   9163+* *                                                            @D32XDRP 58364032
                                   9164+* *  OUTPUT:                                                   @D32XDRP 58370032
                                   9165+* *      R1 - POINTS TO VIRTUAL CCB, UNLESS THE PIB IS POSTED  @D32XDRP 58376032
                                   9166+* *             - INDICATING MAVECCB: THE R1 IS UNCHANGED      @D32XDRP 58382032
                                   9167+* *      R8 - UNCHANGED                                        @D32XDRP 58388032
                                   9168+* *      RA - UNCHANGED                                        @D32XDRP 58394032
                                   9169+* *      R9 - UNCHANGED                                        @D32XDRP 58400032
                                   9170+* *      RB - UNCHANGED                                        @D32XDRP 58406032
                                   9171+* *                                                            @D32XDRP 58450032
                                   9172+* *  EXTERNAL REFERENCES:                                      @D32XDRP 58452032
                                   9173+* *      TFREE   - ROUTINE TO FREE A PAGE                      @D32XDRP 58454032

       DOS SUPERVISOR      CCW TRANSLATION  CSWTRANS ROUTINE                                                  PAGE   219


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                   9192+************************************************************** @D32XDRP 58500032

                            07920  9195+CSWTRANS EQU   *                                               @D32XDRP 58600032

       DOS SUPERVISOR       CCWTRANSLATION TESTREPL ROUTINE                                                   PAGE   238


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                   9856+************************************************************** @D32XDRP 70162432
                                   9857+*                                                              @D32XDRP 70162832
                                   9858+*        TEST FOR MATCHING REPLICA   ROUTINE                   @D32XDRP 70163232
                                   9859+*                                                              @D32XDRP 70163632
                                   9860+************************************************************** @D32XDRP 70164032
                                   9861+*                                                              @D32XDRP 70164432
                                   9862+*      FUNCTION:                                               @D32XDRP 70164832
                                   9863+*        THE REPLICA QUEUE OF THE REQUESTOR'S PARTITION IS     @D32XDRP 70165232
                                   9864+*        SEARCHED FOR A MACHTING REPLICA.                      @D32XDRP 70165632
                                   9865+*                                                              @D32XDRP 70166032
                                   9866+*        WHAT IS TRIED IS TO GET SUCCESSIVE MATCHES ON:        @D32XDRP 70166432
                                   9867+*         1) VIRTUAL CCB ADDRESS                               @D32XDRP 70166832
                                   9868+*         2) VIRTUAL CCB (EXCEPT FOR THE FIRST 6 BYTES)        @D32XDRP 70167232
                                   9869+*         3) VIRTUAL CCW-STRING                                @D32XDRP 70167632
                                   9870+*        IF UNSUCCESSFUL, THE NEXT REPLICA IN THE QUEUE IS     @D32XDRP 70168032
                                   9871+*        TRIED UNTIL A) MACHTING REPLICA IS FOUND, OR          @D32XDRP 70168432
                                   9872+*                    B) WHOLE QUEUE IS SCANNED WITHOUT         @D32XDRP 70168832
                                   9873+*                       SUCCESS                                @D32XDRP 70169232
                                   9874+*                                                              @D32XDRP 70169632
                                   9875+*        THE FOLLOWING ACTIONS ARE TAKEN:                      @D32XDRP 70170032
                                   9876+*         A) 1. MATCHING REPLICA IS MOVED TO THE TOP OF THE Q. @D32XDRP 70170432
                                   9877+*            2. TIMESTAMP IS GIVEN                             @D32XDRP 70170832
                                   9878+*            3. R1 IS POINTED AT THE COPIED CCB                @D32XDRP 70171232
                                   9879+*            4. THE SAVEDQ-BIT IN THE CCBFLAG IS TESTED:       @D32XDRP 70171632
                                   9880+*               IF 1- CONTROL IS PASSED TO THE FASTTRNS ROUT.  @D32XDRP 70172032
                                   9881+*               IF 0- R1 IS AGAIN POINTED AT THE VIRTUAL CCB   @D32XDRP 70172432
                                   9882+*                     AND CONTROL IS RETURNED TO THE REGULAR   @D32XDRP 70172832
                                   9883+*                     CCW-TRANSLATE ROUTINE CCWTRANS           @D32XDRP 70173232
                                   9884+*         B) 1. IN THE TCB THE REPLICA CREATION FLAG (RFLAG)   @D32XDRP 70173632
                                   9885+*               AND THE 1ST CCW SWITCH (CCW1SW) ARE SET)       @D32XDRP 70174032
                                   9886+*            2. THE NUMBER OF FREE DIDA WORDS (DIDALCNT)       @D32XDRP 70174432
                                   9887+*               IS INITIALIZED TO ONE                          @D32XDRP 70174832
                                   9888+*            3. CONTROL IS GIVEN BACK TO CCWTRANS              @D32XDRP 70175232
                                   9889+*                                                              @D32XDRP 70175632
                                   9890+*      ENTRY POINTS:                                           @D32XDRP 70176032
                                   9891+*        TESTREPL - FROM CCWTRANS FOR NON-BTAM REQUESTS        @D32XDRP 70176432
                                   9892+*                                                              @D32XDRP 70176832
                                   9893+*      INPUT:                                                  @D32XDRP 70177232
                                   9894+*        R1 - POINTS TO VIRTUAL CCB                            @D32XDRP 70177632
                                   9895+*        R8 - RETURN ADDRESS                                   @D32XDRP 70177732
                                   9896+*        RF - POINTS TO TCB                                    @D32XDRP 70178032
                                   9897+*        R8 - RETURN ADDRESS IF NO REPLICA FOUND               @D32XDRP 70178232
                                   9898+*        R9 - FIRST BASE ADDRESS                               @D32XDRP 70178432
                                   9899+*        RB - SECOND BASE ADDRESS                              @D32XDRP 70178832
                                   9900+*        PIK                                                   @D32XDRP 70179232
                                   9901+*        TCBFLAG-BITS:                                         @D32XDRP 70179632
                                   9902+*           RFLAG  - 0                                         @D32XDRP 70180032
                                   9903+*                                                              @D32XDRP 70180832
                                   9904+*      OUTPUT:                                                 @D32XDRP 70181232
                                   9905+*        R1 - POINTS TO COPIED CCB IF MATCHING REPLICA FOUND   @D32XDRP 70181632
                                   9906+*           - AND COPIED CCB RESIDING ON THE 'SAVED' QUEUE.    @D32XDRP 70182032
                                   9907+*           - OTHERWISE UNCHANGED                              @D32XDRP 70182432
                                   9908+*        R8 - UNCHANGED                                        @D32XDRP 70182532
                                   9909+*        RF - UNCHANGED                                        @D32XDRP 70182832
                                   9910+*        R9 - UNCHANGED                                        @D32XDRP 70183232

       DOS SUPERVISOR       CCWTRANSLATION TESTREPL ROUTINE                                                   PAGE   239

                                   9913+*        TCBFLAG-BITS:                                         @D32XDRP 70184432
