                                  10162+************************************************************** @D32XDRP 70264932
                                  10163+*                                                              @D32XDRP 70265232
                                  10164+*        FREE CCB  (DELETE REPLICA)  ROUTINE                   @D32XDRP 70265532
                                  10165+*                                                              @D32XDRP 70265832
                                  10166+************************************************************** @D32XDRP 70266132
                                  10167+*      FUNCTION:                                               @D32XDRP 70266432
                                  10168+*        A REPLICA AND ITS ASSOCIATED CCB COPY, TOGETHER WITH  @D32XDRP 70266732
                                  10169+*        CCW-S, IDAL AND DIDAL, ARE DELETED IF THE CCB COPY    @D32XDRP 70267032
                                  10170+*        RESIDES ON THE SAVED-COPY-BLOCK-QUEUE.                @D32XDRP 70267332
                                  10171+*        FIXED DATA AREA PAGES, IF ANY, ARE FREED FIRST.       @D32XDRP 70267632
                                  10172+*        IF THE COPY IS NOT ON THE 'SAVED' QUEUE THEN THERE IS @DA09058 70267934
                                  10173+*        AN IMMEDIATE RETURN WITHOUT ANY ACTION.               @DA09058 70268334
                                  10174+*        IF TESTREPL IS IN PROCESS FOR THIS REPLICA, THEN THE  @DA09058 70268434
                                  10175+*        TASKS HAVING REPLICA SEARCH IN PROCESS ARE SET BACK   @DA09058 70268534
                                  10176+*        TO RESTART TRANSLATION.                               @DA09058 70268634
                                  10177+*        IF THE CCBCOPY IS ON THE SAVED QUEUE BUT THE USERS    @D32XDRP 70268734
                                  10178+*        CCB IS NOT YET POSTED (I.E.I/O COMPLETE BUT RELCCB    @D32XDRP 70268834
                                  10179+*        NOT YET EXECUTED) THE CCB-COPY IS NOT DELETED AND     @D32XDRP 70268932
                                  10180+*        REMAINS ON THE ACTIVE CCB QUEUE. THE FASTTR- AND      @D32XDRP 70269132
                                  10181+*        AND SAVEQ-BITS ARE SET OFF.                           @D32XDRP 70269332
                                  10182+*                                                              @D32XDRP 70270032
                                  10183+*      ENTRY POINTS:                                           @D32XDRP 70270232
                                  10184+*        DELREPL - FROM CREATREP AND DELREPA ROUTINE           @D32XDRP 70270432
                                  10185+*        FREECCB - FROM GETBLOCK EXCEPTION HANDLING CODE       @D32XDRP 70270632
                                  10186+*                  (GETBL1)                                    @D32XDRP 70270832
                                  10187+*                - AND FROM RELCCB ROUTINE                     @D32XDRP 70271032
                                  10188+*                                                              @D32XDRP 70271232
                                  10189+*      INPUT:                                                  @D32XDRP 70271432
                                  10190+*      A. WHEN ENTERED AT DELREPL:                             @D32XDRP 70271632
                                  10191+*         R2 - RETURN ADDRESS                                  @D32XDRP 70271832
                                  10192+*         R7 - POINTS TO PARTITION'S REPLICA QUEUE             @D32XDRP 70272032
                                  10193+*         R8 - POINTS TO REPLICA THAT IS TO BE DELETED         @D32XDRP 70272232
                                  10194+*         R9 - FIRST BASE ADDRESS                              @D32XDRP 70272432
                                  10195+*         RB - SECOND BASE ADDRESS                             @D32XDRP 70272632
                                  10196+*      B. WHEN ENTERED AT FREECCB:                             @D32XDRP 70272832

                                  10198+*            - (ALWAYS THE BOTTOM ELEMENT IN THE SAVED-CCB-    @D32XDRP 70273232
                                  10199+*            - COPY-BLOCK-QUEUE)                               @D32XDRP 70273432
                                  10200+*         R2 - RETURN ADDRESS                                  @D32XDRP 70273632

                                  11321+* OCCUR ONLY IF THE REQUEST CAN BE SERVICED IMMEDIATELY,       @DL29ZCJ 29430031

                                  12208+*        REGISTER USAGE :                                               60600031
                                  12209+*              R0 - POINTER TO PARAMETER LIST                           60630031

                                  13604+*   THIS ROUTINE PUTS ALL SELECTION-POOL-PAGE-FRAMES OF A               26640031
                                  13605+*   DEACTIVATED PARTITION TO QUEUES Q00 OR Q01 RESP. DEPENDING ON       26670031
                                  13606+*   THE VALUE OF THE CHANGE-BITS AND RESETS THE REFERENCE-BITS          26700031

                                  13725+*********************************************************************   32970031
                                  13726+*                                                                       33000031
                                  13727+*        THE DEACTIVATION ROUTINE TRIES TO DEACTIVATE THE VIRTUAL       33030031
                                  13728+*        PARTITION WHICH CURRENTLY HAS THE LOWEST DISPATCHING           33060031
                                  13729+*        PRIORITY.                                                      33090031
                                  13730+*        IF ONLY ONE VIRTUAL PARTITION IS ACTIVE OR IF ANY TASK         33120031
                                  13731+*        SEIZES THE SYSTEM THE DEACTIVATION REQUEST IS IGNORED.         33150031
                                  13732+*        IF THE PARTITION WITH THE LOWEST DISPATCHING PRIORITY          33180031
                                  13733+*        CURRENTLY OWNS THE B-TRANSIENT AREA OR IS INDICATED THAT IT    33210031
                                  13734+*        SHALL BE CANCELED THE DEACTIVATION ROUTINE TRIES TO DEACTI-    33240031
                                  13735+*        VATE THE VIRTUAL PARTITION WITH THE NEXT HIGHER DISPAT-        33270031
                                  13736+*        CHING PRIORITY.                                                33300031
                                  13737+*                                                                       33330031

                                  14440+*********************************************************************** 13400032

                                  14531+*********************************************************************** 17550032
                                  14532+*   - CONVERTS T.O.D FOR GMT INTO T.O.D FOR THE ZONE GIVEN IN RF      * 17600032
                                  14533+*   - CALCULATES THE DAY DIFFERENCE FROM LATEST DATE FOR THAT ZONE    * 17650032
                                  14534+*********************************************************************** 17700032

00B574 07F9                       14546+         BR    R9                 RETURN                                18300032

                                  14548+*                     ***********************                         * 18400032
                                  14549+*                     * S U B R O U T I N E *                         * 18450032
                                  14550+*********************************************************************** 18500032
                                  14551+*   - CONVERTS THE OLD GMT MIDNIGHT VALUE INTO THE ACTUAL DATE        * 18550032
                                  14552+*     IN THE FORM DDMMYY OR MMDDYY UNPACKED FORMAT                    * 18600032
                                  14553+*   - SAVES THE BINARY VALUE OF YYDDD IN THE FIELD 'DDDYYFLD'         * 18650032
                                  14554+*********************************************************************** 18700032
00B576 9823 B548            01548 14555+DATEGEN  LM    R2,R3,MIDNIGHT     LOAD MIDNIGHT VALUE                   18750032
00B57A 5D20 B584            01584 14556+         D     R2,DIVCONS1        DIVIDE BY 100 DAYS IN SECONDS         18800032
00B57E 5D20 B594            01594 14557+         D     R2,DIVCONS2        AND BY 10000 TO GET NUMBER OF DAYS    18850032
                                  14558+*              DIVCONS1 IS 100 TIMES 86400 (NUMBER OF SECONDS IN 1 DAY) 18900032
                                  14559+* THIS CONSTANT IS USED TO GET QUOTIENT IN REG R3                       18950032
                                  14560+* REG R2 WILL CONTAIN ZEROES (MIDNIGHT IS WHOLE NUMBER OF DAYS)         19000032
                                  14561+* THEN THESE REGISTERS ARE DIVIDED BY 10000 (DIVCONS2) TO GET           19050032
                                  14562+* TOTAL NUMBER OF DAYS IN REG R3 IN THE FORM DDDDD, WHICH IS            19100032
                                  14563+* CONVERTED INTO YYDDD IN THE ROUTINE BELOW                             19150032
                                  14564+*                                                                       19200032
00B582 1A34                       14565+         AR    R3,R4              ADJUST BY DAY DIFFERENCE              19250032
00B584 4133 0001            00001 14566+DATEGMT  LA    R3,D1(R3)          SIMULATE 1900 LEAP YEAR               19300032
00B588 5D20 B588            01588 14567+         D     R2,FOURYEAR        DIVIDE BY DAYS IN 4 YEARS             19350032
00B58C 8930 0002            00002 14568+         SLL   R3,D2              MULTIPLY YEARS BY 4                   19400032
00B590 4122 0001            00001 14569+         LA    R2,D1(R2)          ADD 1 TO GET VALID DATE               19450032
00B594 41F0 016E            0016E 14570+         LA    RF,LEAPYEAR        INITIALIZE REG BY 366                 19500032
00B598 192F                       14571+LOOPDAYS CR    R2,RF              BRANCH IF NOT MORE DAYS               19550032
00B59A 47D0 71F2      0B5AC       14572+         BNH   DAYSEXIT           * THAN 366 (OR 365 LATER)             19600032
00B59E 4133 0001            00001 14573+         LA    R3,D1(R3)          ADD 1 TO YEAR VALUE                   19650032
00B5A2 1B2F                       14574+         SR    R2,RF              SUBTRACT 366 OR 365                   19700032
00B5A4 41F0 016D            0016D 14575+         LA    RF,NOLPYEAR        INITIALIZE REG BY 365                 19750032
00B5A8 47F0 71DE      0B598       14576+         B     LOOPDAYS           RETURN TO LOOP (MAX 3 TIMES)          19800032
00B5AC 9023 B570            01570 14577+DAYSEXIT STM   R2,R3,DDDYYFLD     SAVE YY AND DDD                       19850032
00B5B0 1BFF                       14578+         SR    RF,RF              CLEAR WORK REGISTER                   19900032
00B5B2 921C B5A5      015A5       14579+         MVI   FEBRUARY,FEBNOLP   SET FEBRUARY TO 28                    19950032
00B5B6 9103 B577      01577       14580+         TM    YYFLD,LEAP         BRANCH TO SKIP SETTING 29             20000032
00B5BA 4770 7208      0B5C2       14581+         BNZ   INITOK             * IF NOT LEAP YEAR                    20050032
00B5BE 921D B5A5      015A5       14582+         MVI   FEBRUARY,FEBLEAP   SET FEBRUARY TO 29                    20100032
00B5C2 41E0 0001            00001 14583+INITOK   LA    RE,ONE             INITIALIZE MONTH REGISTER             20150032
00B5C6 43FE B5A3            015A3 14584+LOOPMONT IC    RF,MONTHTAB(RE)    PICK UP DAY VALUE                     20200032
00B5CA 192F                       14585+         CR    R2,RF              COMPARE WITH DDD                      20250032

                                  14767+*                                                                    RZ 00536428
                                  14768+         DROP  R8                                                    VD 00548228
                            00000 14769+         USING SVEARA,R9                                       @DL295HL 00554129
                            0B7D0 14770+         USING *,RE .             REG 14 IS BASE               @DL295HL 00600029
                            0B7D0 14771+CDLOAD   EQU   * .                ENTRY-POINT OF VSAM POUTINES @DL295HL 00610029
                                  14772+************************************************************** @DM14638 00616032
                                  14773+*                                                            *          00617032
                                  14774+* THE CDLOAD MACRO ROUTINE IS ENTERED IF AN SVC 65 IS ISSUED *          00620032
                                  14775+* THE GENERAL SVC ENTRY ROUTINE TRANSFERS CONTROL TO CDLOAD. * @DM12777 00621032
                                  14776+* AT THE BEGINNING THE NAME OF THE PHASE IS MOVED INTO THE   * @DM12777 00622032
                                  14777+* SYSTEM SAVE AREA AT CALLNAME.                              * @DM12777 00623032
                                  14778+* IF THE ANCHOR TABLE HAS BEEN BUILT PREVIOUSLY AND IT       * @DM12777 00624032
                                  14779+* CONTAINS AN ENTRY FOR THE REQUESTED PHASE, CONTROL IS      * @DM12777 00625032
                                  14780+* RETURNED IMMEDIATELY.                                      * @DM12777 00626032
                                  14781+* IF THE ANCHOR TABLE EITHER DOES NOT CONTAIN AN ENTRY FOR   * @DM12777 00627032
                                  14782+* THE REQUESTED PHASE, OR HAS NOT YET BEEN BUILT, A LOAD IS  * @DM12777 00628032
                                  14783+* ISSUED WITH TXT=NO AND DE=YES.                             * @DM12777 00629032
                                  14784+*  ( THE 34-BYTE DIRECTORY ENTRY WHICH HAS TO BE PROVIDED BY *          00630032
                                  14785+*    THE LOAD FOR THE FETCH ROUTINE WILL BE LOCATED IN THE   *          00631032
                                  14786+*    SYSTEM SAVE AREA OF THE TASK STARTING AT CALLNAME. SO   *          00632032
                                  14787+*    THE INSTRUCTION IN FETCH WHICH MOVES THE DE INTO THE    *          00633032
                                  14788+*    LOCATION SPECIFIED BY THE USER IS A NOP-INSTRUCTION FOR *          00634032
                                  14789+*    THE LOAD ISSUED BY CDLOAD)                              *          00635032
                                  14790+*                                                            *          00636032
                                  14791+* IF THE PHASE IS FOUND IN THE SVA THE RETURN CODE AND THE   * @DM12777 00637032
                                  14792+* RETURN PARAMETERS ARE STORED INTO THE PP-SAVE AREA.        * @DM12777 00638032
                                  14793+* OTHERWISE A TEST IS MADE TO DETERMINE WHETHER THE          * @DM12777 00639032
                                  14794+* ANCHOR TABLE HAS BEEN BUILT PREVIOUSLY. IF NOT, THE        * @DM12777 00640032
                                  14795+* GTVISINIT ROUTINE IS CALLED TO BUILD THE TABLE, AND        * @DM12777 00641032
                                  14796+* SUBSEQUENTLY THE TABLE IS INITIALIZED.                     * @DM12777 00642032
                                  14797+*    THE GTVSINIT ROUTINE CHECKS THAT SIZE WAS SPECIFIED     * @DM12777 00643032
                                  14798+*    IN THE EXEC STATEMENT AND THAT THE PROGRAM RUNS IN A    *          00644032
                                  14799+*    VIRTUAL PARTITION. IT SETS THE REGISTERS R4 TO THE      *          00645032
                                  14800+*    PP-SAVEAREA AND ANCHBAS TO THE ANCHORTABLE.             *          00649032
                                  14801+*    THE RETURNCODE REGISTER REG15 WHICH PASSES THE PAGE     *          00650032
                                  14802+*    PARAMETER TO THE SVC ROUTINE IS STORED IN PP-SAVEAREA   *          00651032
                                  14803+*    AND CONTAINS THE RETUNCODE 0,4,8 DEPENDENT WHETHER OR   *          00652032
                                  14804+*    NOT AN ERROR WAS FOUND DURING GTVSINIT EXECUTION.       *          00653032
                                  14805+*                                                            *          00670032
                                  14806+* WHEN THE PHASE WILL BE LOADED INTO THE PARTITION OF THE    *          00671032
                                  14807+* REQUESTOR A SECOND LOAD WITH DE=YES AND TXT=YES IS ISSUED. *          00672032
                                  14808+*                                                            *          00675032
                                  14809+************************************************************** @DM14638 00676032
00B7D0 5890 A008            00008 14810+         L     R9,PIBSAV2 .       GETADDR OF SYSTEM SAVE AREA  @DL295HL 00680029
00B7D4 D207 9068 1000 00068 00000 14811+         MVC   CALLNAME,D0(R1) .  SAVE PHASE NAME              @DL295HL 00685029
                            0B7DA 14812+PCKSVC65 EQU   *        USED BY PAGE MANAGER IF R1 INCORRECT   @DM14661 00690032

       DOS SUPERVISOR                 GETVIS/FREEVIS ROUTINES                                                 PAGE   362


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                  14993+*********************************************************************RZ 02450028
                                  14994+*                                                                    RZ 02500028
                                  14995+*                                                                    RZ 02550028
                                  14996+*        GETVIS/FREEVIS ROUTINES                                     RZ 02600028
                                  14997+*                                                                    RZ 02650028
                                  14998+*                                                                    RZ 02700028
                                  14999+*********************************************************************RZ 02750028
                                  15000+*        GETVIS/FREEVIS ARE USED TO GET/RELEASE VIRTUAL STORAGE         02751029
                                  15001+*        IN THE GETVIS AREA OF THE USER PARTITION OR OF THE SVA.        02752029
                                  15002+*        THE GETVIS AREA IS MAPPED ON A BITSTRING (VISTAB).             02753029
                                  15003+*        EACH BIT REPRESENTS 128 BYTES OF VIRTUAL STORAGE               02754029
                                  15004+*        IN THE USER GETVIS AREA OR 512 BYTES IN THE SVA.               02755029
                                  15005+*        THE VISTAB IS LOCATED ON THE FIRST PAGE OF THE                 02756029
                                  15006+*        GETVIS AREA IN A USER'S PARTITION OR ON THE FIRST AND          02757029
                                  15007+*        SECOND PAGE IN THE GETVIS AREA OF THE SVA.                     02758029
                                  15008+*        THE MAXIMUM SIZE OF THE VISTAB FOR A USER PARTITION IS         02759029
                                  15009+*        994 BYTES REPRESENTING 1017856 BYTES OF VIRTUAL STORAGE.       02760029
                                  15010+*        THE VISTAB OF THE SVA REPRESENTS UP TO 12460032 BYTES.         02761029
                                  15011+*                                                                    RZ 03100028
                                  15012+*                                                                    RZ 03150028
                                  15013+*                                                                    RZ 03200028

       DOS SUPERVISOR                 GETVIS/FREEVIS ROUTINES                                                 PAGE   363

                            0B9B8 15015+GETVIS   EQU   * .                                                   RZ 03250028

                            00000 15017+         USING ANCHTAB,ANCHBAS .                               @DL295HL 03270029
00B9B8 4520 E4CE            0BC9E 15018+         BAL   LINKREG,GTVSINIT . CHECK SOME ERRORS                  RZ 03300028
                                  15019+*        ALL ADDRESSES NOW O.K.                                      RZ 03350028
                                  15020+*                                                                    RZ 03400028
                                  15021+*        SEARCH A BITSTRING                                          RZ 03450028
                                  15022+*                                                                    RZ 03500028
                                  15023+*                                                                    RZ 03550028
                                  15024+*        THIS ROUTINE SEARCHES A BITSTRING OF '0'S OF THE REQUIRED   RZ 03600028
                                  15025+*        LENGTH CONTAINED IN REG 0 (# OF '0' BITS = (CONTENTS        RZ 03650029
                                  15026+*        OF REG 0 + 127)/128).THE SEARCH STARTS AT THE CURRENT       RZ 03700029
                                  15027+*        POINTER AND CONTINUES UNTIL A BITSTRING IS FOUND OR THE     RZ 03750028
                                  15028+*        VISTAB IS EXHAUSTED.THE CURRENT POINTER IS INITIALIZED      RZ 03800028
                                  15029+*        WITH THE START ADDRESS OF THE VISTAB AND IS UPDATED BY      RZ 03850028
                                  15030+*        EACH GETVIS REQUEST WITH THE LAST OCCUPIED ADDRESS IN THE   RZ 03900028
                                  15031+*        VISTAB.IF POOL WAS SPECIFIED,THE ADDRESS PASSED IN REG 1    RZ 03950028
                                  15032+*        IS USED TO CALCULATE A NEW CURRENT POINTER.                 RZ 04000028

                                  15034+*        TEST LENGTH CORRECT                                         RZ 04100028

00B9BC 1200                       15036+         LTR   REG0,REG0 .                                           RZ 04150028

00B9D0 4720 E41E      0BBEE       15042+         BH    RET12 .            GETVIS AREA                        RZ 04400028

                                  15046+*                                                                    RZ 04550028

                                  15273+*                                                                    RZ 12150028
                                  15274+*                                                                    RZ 12200028
                                  15275+*                                                                    RZ 12250028
                                  15276+*        THIS ROUTINE SETS A BITSTRING IN THE VISTAB TO              RZ 12300028
                                  15277+*        '0'S OR  TO '1'S DEPENDING                                  RZ 12350028
                                  15278+*        ON REG 0 : X'FFFFFF00' OR X'000000FF'.                      RZ 12400028

                                  15280+*        SSEARCH,THE BIT # IN SVWORK1                                RZ 12500028

                                  15283+*        CREG IS USED AS POINTER INTO VISTAB                         RZ 12650028

                                  15344+*********************************************************************** 15404029
                                  15345+*                                                                       15405029
                                  15346+*        INITIALIZATION ROUTINE                                         15406029
                                  15347+*                                                                       15407029
                                  15348+*        THE INITIALIZATION ROUTINE IS ENTERED BY GETVIS/FREEVIS/CDLOAD 15408029
                                  15349+*        VIA BAL LINKREG,GTVSINIT                                       15409029
                                  15350+*                                                                       15410029
                                  15351+*        RUNMODE IS TESTED,IF REAL:ERROR,RETURN CODE 8                  15411029
                                  15352+*        IF SIZE WAS NOT SPECIFIED IN THE EXEC STATEMENT OR             15412029
                                  15353+*        IN THE SET SVA=... COMMAND:ERROR,RETURN CODE 4                 15413029
                                  15354+*                                                                       15414029
                                  15355+*        THE ADDRESS OF THE ANCHOR TABLE (USED FOR CDLOAD)              15415029
                                  15356+*        IS CALCULATED AND PUT INTO REGISTER ANCHBAS                    15416029
                                  15357+*                                                                       15417029
                                  15358+*        THE VISTAB IS REFERENCED TO ENSURE THAT NO PAGE FAULT          15418029
                                  15359+*        CAN OCCUR DURING CHANGE OF THE VISTAB                          15419029
                                  15360+*                                                                       15420029
                                  15361+*        IF THE INITIALIZATION ROUTINE IS ENTERED THE FIRST TIME,       15421029
                                  15362+*        SOME ADDRESSES (START+END ADDRESSES OF VISTAB,OF GETVIS        15422029
                                  15363+*        AREA,...)                                                      15423229
                                  15364+*        ARE CALCULATED AND STORED.A BIT IS SET TO INDICATE THAT THESE  15424029
                                  15365+*        ADDRESSES ARE AVAILABLE AND THEY ARE NOT CALCULATED AGAIN IN   15425029
                                  15366+*        FOLLOWING REQUESTS.                                            15426029
                                  15367+*        THE BIT IS LOCATED IN THE COMREG BYTE 134 BIT 7 FOR USER       15427029
                                  15368+*        PARTITION,FOR THE SVA IT IS BIT 7 IN BYTE 0 OF THE END ADDRESS 15428029
                                  15369+*        OF THE 'USER PART' OF THE SVA.                                 15430029

       DOS SUPERVISOR     MCRAS        MACHINE CHECK HANDLER                                                  PAGE   390


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                  16173+* SUPERVISOR - MCRAS - 5745-SC-SUP - REL. 34.1                 @DY20278 00386634
                                  16174+*---------------------------------------------------------------------* 00630025
                                  16175+*        R E S I D E N T   M A C H I N E   C H E C K   H A N D L E R  * 00720025
                                  16176+*                                                                     * 00810025
                                  16177+*                                                                     * 00860034
                                  16178+*                                                                     * 00990025
                                  16179+* FUNCTION                                                            * 01080025
                                  16180+*    THE FUNCTION OF THIS ROUTINE IS TO DETERMINE THE SEVERITY OF A   * 01170025
                                  16181+*    MACHINE CHECK INTERRUPTION AND SCHEDULE THE PROPER FUNCTIONS.    * 01260025
                                  16182+*    WHEN A MACHINE CHECK OCCURS ALL MACHINE CHECKS ARE MASKED OFF BY * 01350025
                                  16183+*    BIT 13 OF THE MACHINE CHECK NEW PSW BEING OFF.  AT ENTRY TO THIS * 01440025
                                  16184+*    ROUTINE CONTROL REGISTER 14 IS LOADED WITH A CODE THAT WILL MASK * 01530025
                                  16185+*    ALL SOFT MACHINE CHECKS DURING MACHINE CHECK PROCESSING.  AFTER  * 01620025
                                  16186+*    THE SEVERITY OF THE ERROR IS DETERMINED HARD MACHINE CHECKS WILL * 01710025
                                  16187+*    BE ALLOWED IF THE ERROR IS NOT CLASS1. THIS IS DONE BY LOADING A * 01800025
                                  16188+*    PSW WITH BIT 13 ON. THE ERROR WILL FALL INTO 1 OF 4 CLASSES.     * 01890025
                                  16189+*    CLASS1                                                           * 01980025
                                  16190+*    SYSTEM DAMAGE BIT ON IN THE MCIC                                 * 02070025
                                  16191+*    THE AMWP FIELD OF THE MACHINE CHECK OLD PSW IS INVALID           * 02160025
                                  16192+*    PROCESSING DAMAGE OCCURRED IN PRIVILEGED CODE.                   * 02250025
                                  16193+*    CLASS2                                                           * 02340025
                                  16194+*    PROCESSING DAMAGE OCCURRED IN NON-PRIVILEGED CODE.               * 02430025
                                  16195+*    NON-PRIVILEGED CODE WAS INTERRUPTED AND THE MACHINE CHECK OLD    * 02520025
                                  16196+*    PSW IS NOT COMPLETELY VALID AS STORED.                           * 02610025
                                  16197+*    CLASS3                                                           * 02700025
                                  16198+*    RECOVERY REPORT(SOFT MACHINE CHECK) OCCURRED IN PRIVILEGED CODE  * 02790025
                                  16199+*    CLASS4                                                           * 02880025
                                  16200+*    RECOVERY REPORT(SOFT MACHINE CHECK) IN NON-PRIVILEGED CODE       * 02970025
                                  16201+*                                                                     * 03060025
                                  16202+*    THE ACTIONS SCHEDULED FOR EACH CLASS OF ERROR IS LISTED IN THE   * 03150026
                                  16203+*    ACTION TABLE BELOW.  IF A TASK IS TO BE CANCELLED, THE ERROR     * 03200026
                                  16204+*    CODE IS PLACED IN THE PIB BEFORE THE EXIT IS TAKEN.              * 03210026
                                  16205+*                                                                     * 03240025
                                  16206+*    * * * * * * * *   A C T I O N    T A B L E   * * * * * * * *     * 03330025
                                  16207+* CLASS   EXIT TAKEN    ACTIONS SCHEDULED AND/OR PERFORMED            * 03420025
                                  16208+*    1    EMGEX9        RECORDING,HARD WAIT MESSAGE,TERMINATE SYSTEM  * 03510025
                                  16209+*    2    EXIT          RECORDING, CANCEL THE DAMAGED TASK            * 03600028
                                  16210+*    3    OLD PSW       RECORDING,  RETURN TO INTERRUPTED CODE        * 03690025
                                  16211+*    4    EXIT          RECORDING, TASK SELECTION                     * 03780028
                                  16212+*                                                                     * 03870025
                                  16213+* ENTRY POINTS                                                        * 03960025
                                  16214+*         MACHEK        ENTERED VIA MACHINE CHECK NEW PSW             * 04050025
                                  16215+*         EMGEX0        IRRECOVERABLE CHANNEL CHECK ON PAGING         * 04100028
                                  16216+*                       DEVICE OR CHANNEL                             * 04110028
                                  16217+*         EMGEX1        CHANNEL ADDRESS NOT VALID ON CHANNEL CHECK    * 04140025
                                  16218+*         EMGEX4        2 CHAN DAMAGED OR RTA I/O ACT.                * 04410028
                                  16219+*         EMGEX5        ERPIB QUEUE EXHAUSTED                         * 04500025
                                  16220+*         EMGEX6        NO ECSW STORED                                * 04590026
                                  16221+*         EMGEX7        CC ERROR ON LOG WITH RAS MSG SCHEDULED        * 04680025
                                  16222+*         EMGEX8        UNRECOVERABLE CHANNEL CHECK ON FETCH          * 04770025
                                  16223+* INPUT                                                               * 04950025
                                  16224+*    THE MACHINE CHECK OLD PSW                                        * 05040025
                                  16225+*    INDEPENDENT LOG OUT AREA                                         * 05130025
                                  16226+* OUTPUT                                                              * 05220025
                                  16227+*    LOWCORE MESSAGE                                                  * 05310025

       DOS SUPERVISOR     MCRAS        MACHINE CHECK HANDLER                                                  PAGE   391


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                  16228+* EXTERNAL REFERENCES                                                 * 05400025
                                  16229+*         LABEL    NAME AND LOCATION                                  * 05490025
                                  16230+*                                                                     * 05580025
                                  16231+*         MCIC     MACHINE CHECK INTERRUPT CODE IN LOG OUT AREA       * 05670025

                                  16262+*         MCOLDP   RESUME PRIVILEGED CODE                             * 07740025
                                  16263+*                                                                     * 07830025

                                  16265+*         CHECKR0  EMERGENCY CALL FOR $$RAST00                        * 07940034

       DOS SUPERVISOR       MCRAS         RAS MONITOR ROUTINE                                                 PAGE   395


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                  16413+*---------------------------------------------------------------------* 17730025
                                  16414+*        R A S   M O N I T O R   R O U T I N E                        * 17820025
                                  16415+*                                                                     * 17910025
                                  16416+*                                                                     * 18090025
                                  16417+* FUNCTION                                                            * 18180025
                                  16418+*    SCHEDULE I/O REQUESTS FOR THE RTA MODULES                        * 18270025
                                  16419+*    FETCH MODULES INTO THE RTA                                       * 18360025
                                  16420+*                                                                     * 18450025
                                  16421+*    THE RAS MONITOR ACTS AS AN INTERFACE BETWEEN THE RTA AND THE     * 18540025
                                  16422+*   SUPERVISOR.  IT WILL SCHEDULE I/O REQUESTS FROM THE RTA AND       * 18630025
                                  16423+*   RETURN CONTROL TO THE RTA WHEN THE I/O REQUEST IS COMPLETE.       * 18720025
                                  16424+*                                                                     * 18810025
                                  16425+*    WHEN AN RTA MODULE COMPLETES IT'S FUNCTION OR REQUIRES THE       * 18900025
                                  16426+*    SERVICES OF ANOTHER RTA MODULE, THIS ROUTINE WILL FETCH THE      * 18990025
                                  16427+*    MODULE INTO THE RTA.  TO PERFORM THE FETCH, THE ENTRY IN THE     * 19080025
                                  16428+*    LOAD LIST FOR THE MODULE TO BE FETCHED WILL BE EXPANDED INTO     * 19170025
                                  16429+*    AN ABSOLUTE SEEK ADDRESS AND THE MODULE IS READ INTO THE RTA.    * 19260025
                                  16430+*                                                                     * 19350025
                                  16431+*    THIS ROUTINE WILL GAIN CONTROL FROM THE SUPERVISOR AT EXIT       * 19440025
                                  16432+*    TIME WHEN THE RAS ACTIVE BIT IS ON.  IF THE I/O REQUEST HAS      * 19530025
                                  16433+*    COMPLETED, CONTROL IS RETURNED TO THE RTA MODULE.  IF THE I/O    * 19620025
                                  16434+*    REQUEST HAS NOT COMPLETED, THE SUPERVISOR REGAINS CONTROL.       * 19710025
                                  16435+*                                                                     * 19800025
                                  16436+*    IN AN EMERGENCY SITUATION THE NORMAL I/O REQUEST IS BYPASSED AND * 19890025
                                  16437+*    THE ERROR SIO ROUTINE IN THE SUPERVISOR IS USED TO PERFORM THE   * 19980025
                                  16438+*    I/O REQUESTS FOR THE RTA MODULES.                                * 20070025
                                  16439+*                                                                     * 20160025
                                  16440+* ENTRY POINTS                                                        * 20250025
                                  16441+*         RASUPR   FROM SUPERVISOR EXIT ROUTINES WHEN RAS IS ACTIVE   * 20340025
                                  16442+*         CHECKR0  FROM EMERGENCY EXIT ROUTINES                       * 20360034
                                  16443+*         CALLRTA  FROM RTA MODULES TO PERFORM FETCH OF NEXT MODULE   * 20610025
                                  16444+*         RASIOR   FROM RTA MODULES TO REQUEST I/O                    * 20700025
                                  16445+*                                                                     * 20790025
                                  16446+* INPUT                                                               * 20880025
                                  16447+*    REGISTER 3    INDEX TO LOAD LIST ENTRY OF MODULE TO BE FETCHED   * 20970025
                                  16448+*    REGISTER 7    RETURN ADDRESS FOR THE RTA MODULE MAKING REQUEST   * 21060025
                                  16449+*    REGISTER 8    ADDRESS OF THE RTAIOB OF MODULE MAKING REQUEST     * 21150025
                                  16450+*                 (REGISTERS 7 AND 8 ARE TAKEN FROM TRANSAV)          * 21170034
                                  16451+*                                                                     * 21240025
                                  16452+* OUTPUT  NOT APPLICABLE                                              * 21330025
                                  16453+*                                                                     * 21420025
                                  16454+* EXTERNAL REFERENCES                                                 * 21510025
                                  16455+*            LABEL    NAME AND LOCATION                               * 21600025
                                  16456+*         SYSREGS  SAVE AREA FOR SUPERVISOR REGISTERS IN RAS TABLE    * 21690028
                                  16457+*         TRANSAV  SAVE AREA FOR RTA REGISTERS IN RAS TABLE           * 21710034
                                  16458+*         RASFLAGS RAS FLAGS IN THE RAS LINKAGE AREA                  * 21780025
                                  16459+*         RTAOWN   OWNERSHIP BYTE OF RTA IN RAS TABLE                 * 21870025
                                  16460+*         LD00SLOT LOAD LIST ENTRY OF $$RAST00 IN RAS TABLE           * 21960025
                                  16461+*         RTARETRN RETURN TO RTA MODULE VIA RTA FUNCTION              * 22050034
                                  16462+*         RTA      RAS TRANSIENT AREA                                 * 22140025
                                  16463+*         RASCCWS  RAS FETCH CCW CHAIN IN THE RAS TABLE               * 22230025
                                  16464+*         RASTTR   LOAD LIST IN THE RAS TABLE                         * 22320025
                                  16465+*         RASEEK   DATA ADDRESS FOR SEEK CCW IN RAS TABLE             * 22410025
                                  16466+*         CAW      CHANNEL ADDRESS WORD IN LOW CORE                   * 22500025
                                  16467+*         RASRES   DEVICE ADDRESS OF SYSRES IN THE RAS TABLE          * 22590025

       DOS SUPERVISOR       MCRAS         RAS MONITOR ROUTINE                                                 PAGE   396


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                  16468+*         RASSIO   ERROR SIO ROUTINE IN RTA FUNCTIONS                 * 22950034
                                  16469+*         SOFTPSW  PSW IN MACHINE CHECK HANDLER                       * 23130025
                                  16470+*         RTAID    ID OF I/O REQUEST FOR RTA MODULE IN RAS TABLE      * 23220025
                                  16471+*         RASCCB   RAS CCB IN THE RAS TABLE                           * 23240034

                                  16486+*                                                                     * 24210025
                                  16487+* TABLES/WORK AREAS,NOT APPLICABLE                                    * 24300025
                                  16488+*                                                                     * 24390025
                                  16489+* ATTRIBUTES                                                          * 24480025
                                  16490+*    REENTRANT,DISABLED,PRIVILEGED,RESIDENT                           * 24570025
                                  16491+*                                                                     * 24660025
                                  16492+* CHARACTER CODE DEPENDENCY  NOT APPLICABLE                           * 24750025
                                  16493+*                                                                     * 24840025
                                  16494+* NOTES                                                               * 24930025
                                  16495+*    THE RAS MONITOR IS ACTIVE ONLY AFTER A MACHINE CHECK OR A        * 25020025
                                  16496+*    CHANNEL CHECK.  IT REMAINS ACTIVE UNTIL ALL FUNCTIONS HAVE       * 25110025
                                  16497+*    BEEN COMPLETED BY THE RTA MODULES.                               * 25200025
                                  16498+*---------------------------------------------------------------------* 25290025

                                  16606+*                                                                     * 34110025
                                  16607+*        R E S I D E N T   C H A N N E L    C H E C K   H A N D L E R * 34200025
                                  16608+*                                                                     * 34290025
                                  16609+* FUNCTION                                                            * 34470025
                                  16610+*    DETERMINE THE SEVERITY OF THE CHANNEL CHECK                      * 34560025
                                  16611+*    DETERMINE IF A DAMAGED CHANNEL EXISTS                            * 34650025
                                  16612+*    FIND AND FILL AN ERPIB FOR INITIAL ERRORS                        * 34740025
                                  16613+*    FIND AND POST THE ERPIB FOR RETRY OF CHANNEL ERRORS              * 34830025
                                  16614+*                                                                     * 34920025
                                  16615+*    THIS ROUTINE WILL GAIN CONTROL FROM EITHER THE SIO OR I/O        * 35010025
                                  16616+*    INTERRUPT ROUTINES WHEN A CHANNEL CHECK OCCURS.  THE ECSW        * 35100025
                                  16617+*    IS INSPECTED TO DETERMINE IF ENOUGH INFORMATION IS VALID TO      * 35190025
                                  16618+*    ISOLATE THE DAMAGE TO EITHER A CHANNEL OR A DEVICE.              * 35280025
                                  16619+*                                                                     * 35370025
                                  16620+*    IF THE DAMAGE CANNOT BE ISOLATED TO A DEVICE, THE ENTIRE         * 35460025
                                  16621+*    CHANNEL IS CONSIDERED DAMAGED.  AN ERPIB IS CREATED WITH THE     * 35550025
                                  16622+*    PUB FIELD OF THE ERPIB CONTAINING THE ADDRESS OF THE DAMAGED     * 35640025
                                  16623+*    CHANNEL.  THE CSW AND ECSW ARE SAVED IN THE ERPIB FOR THE        * 35730025
                                  16624+*    NON-RESIDENT CHANNEL CHECK HANDLER.  IF THE DAMAGE CAN BE        * 35820025
                                  16625+*    ISOLATED TO A DEVICE, THE ENTIRE ERPIB IS FILLED FOR THE         * 35910025
                                  16626+*    NON-RESIDENT CHANNEL CHECK HANDLERS.  IN EITHER CASE THE         * 36000025
                                  16627+*    PROPER FLAGS ARE SET TO INITIATE NON-RESIDENT RECORDING AND      * 36090025
                                  16628+*    RETRY FUNCTIONS.                                                 * 36180025
                                  16629+*                                                                     * 36270025
                                  16630+*    THIS ROUTINE WILL INTERCEPT ALL I/O INTERRUPTS WHEN THE RTA      * 36360025
                                  16631+*    HAS AN I/O REQUEST ACTIVE.  IF THE INTERRUPT BELONGS TO THE      * 36450025
                                  16632+*    RTA, THE ERPIB IS FOUND AND POSTED, THE RAS CCB IS DEQUEUED,     * 36540025
                                  16633+*    AND THE USER'S CCB IS REQUEUED TO THE PUB. IF ANOTHER CHANNEL    * 36630025
                                  16634+*    CHECK HAS OCCURRED, THE NORMAL INTERRUPT ROUTINE IS BYPASSED.    * 36720025
                                  16635+*    THIS PREVENTS POSTING OF THE USER'S CCB AND ALLOWS THE RETRY     * 36810025
                                  16636+*    MODULE TO TRY AGAIN UNDER CONTROL OF A RETRY COUNT.  IF THE      * 36900025
                                  16637+*    RETRY WAS SUCCESSFUL, THE INTERRUPT IS PASSED BACK TO THE        * 36990025
                                  16638+*    NORMAL INTERRUPT HANDLER FOR PROCESSING.                         * 37080025
                                  16639+*    IF THE INTERRUPT DOES NOT BELONG TO THE RTA MODULE, THE          * 37170025
                                  16640+*    INTERRUPT IS PASSED BACK TO THE NORMAL INTERRUPT HANDLER.        * 37260025
                                  16641+*                                                                     * 37350025
                                  16642+*    THIS ROUTINE CAN HANDLE 4 DAMAGED DEVICES, OR 1 DAMAGED          * 37440025
                                  16643+*    CHANNEL AND 3 DAMAGED DEVICES AT ONE TIME.  IF 2 CHANNELS        * 37530025
                                  16644+*    BECOME DAMAGED AT ONE TIME OR THE ERPIB QUEUE OVERFLOWS, AN      * 37620025
                                  16645+*    EXIT IS MADE TO THE EMERGENCY EXIT ROUTINE.                      * 37710025
                                  16646+*                                                                     * 37800025
                                  16647+* ENTRY POINTS                                                        * 37890025
                                  16648+*         CCENTRY1 ENTERED ON THE INITIAL DETECTION OF A CHANNEL CHECK* 37980025
                                  16649+*         CCENTRY2 ENTERED AT INTERRUPT TIME WHEN RTA I/O IS ACTIVE   * 38070025
                                  16650+*                  OR AT SIO TIME FOR A CHANNEL CHECK RETRY REQUEST   * 38250034
                                  16651+*                  IF NO CHANNEL CHECK OCCURED                        * 38260034
                                  16652+*         RASDEQ   ENTRY FROM RTA TO DEQUEUE A CCB                    * 38340025
                                  16653+*                                                                     * 38430025
                                  16654+* INPUT                                                               * 38520025
                                  16655+*    CHANNEL STATUS WORD                                              * 38610025
                                  16656+*    INDEPENDANT CHANNEL LOG OUT (ECSW)                               * 38700034
                                  16657+*    I/O OLD PSW                                                      * 38790025
                                  16658+*                                                                     * 38880025
                                  16659+* OUTPUT                                                              * 38970025

       DOS SUPERVISOR      MCRAS   DASD CHANNEL CHECK HANDLER                                                 PAGE   409


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                  17023+*---------------------------------------------------------------------* 68670025
                                  17024+*   NAME                                                              * 68760025
                                  17025+*        D A S D   C H A N N E L   C H E C K   H A N D L E R          * 68850025
                                  17026+*                                                                     * 68940025
                                  17027+*                                                                     * 69030025
                                  17028+*                                                                     * 69210025
                                  17029+* FUNCTION                                                            * 69300025
                                  17030+*    RETRY DASD CHANNEL CHECKS BY RESTARTING THE CHAIN OF CCW'S       * 69390025
                                  17031+*    CANCEL PROBLEM PROGRAMS IF RETRY FAILS                           * 69480025
                                  17032+*    GO TO EMERGENCY EXIT ROUTINE IF RETRY OF SUPERVISOR REQUEST FAILS* 69570025
                                  17033+*                                                                     * 69750025
                                  17034+*    THIS ROUTINE GAINS CONTROL FROM THE CHANNEL CHECK HANDLER        * 69840025
                                  17035+*    WHEN THE DAMAGED CHANNEL IS A DASD.                              * 70000034
                                  17036+*                                                                     * 70020025
                                  17037+*    THE CHANNEL QUEUE POINTER BYTE OF THE ERPIB IS USED AS AN        * 70110025
                                  17038+*    ERROR COUNTER.  IF THE RETRY COUNT HAS NOT BEEN REACHED AND THE  * 70200025
                                  17039+*    CHANNEL CHECK OCCURRED ON A SIO INSTRUCTION, A BRANCH TO THE SIO * 70290025
                                  17040+*    INSTRUCTION IS TAKEN.  IF THE CHANNEL CHECK OCCURRED AT          * 70380025
                                  17041+*    INTERRUPT TIME A BRANCH TO RESTART THE OPERATION IS TAKEN.       * 70470025
                                  17042+*                                                                     * 70560025
                                  17043+*    IF 10 RETRY ATTEMPTS FAIL, THE TASK IS CANCELLED.  IF THE        * 70650025
                                  17044+*    REQUEST IS OWNED BY THE SUPERVISOR, THE EMERGENCY EXIT ROUTINE   * 70740025
                                  17045+*    IS ENTERED TO TERMINATE THE SYSTEM.  IF THE RETRY ATTEMPT IS     * 70830025
                                  17046+*    SUCCESSFUL, A MESSAGE WILL BE ISSUED AFTER RECORDING THE ERROR   * 70920025
                                  17047+*    TO ALERT THE OPERATOR THAT A SOFT CHANNEL CHECK OCCURRED.        * 71010025
                                  17048+*                                                                     * 71100025
                                  17049+* ENTRY POINTS                                                        * 71190025
                                  17050+*         CCDASDE  ENTERED FROM THE CHANNEL CHECK HANDLER             * 71280025
                                  17051+* INPUT                                                               * 71370025
                                  17052+*    ERPIB                                                            * 71460025
                                  17053+*                                                                     * 71550025
                                  17054+* OUTPUT  NOT APPLICABLE                                              * 71640025
                                  17055+*                                                                     * 71730025
                                  17056+* EXTERNAL REFERENCES                                                 * 71820025
                                  17057+*         LABEL    NAME AND LOCATION                                  * 71910025
                                  17058+*         ERPIBCQP CHANNEL QUEUE POINTER IN THE ERPIB                 * 72000025
                                  17059+*         ERPIBFLG ERPIB FLAGS                                        * 72006034
                                  17060+*         ERPIBREQ REQUESTOR'S ID IN THE ERPIB                        * 72012034
                                  17061+*         RTAID    ID OF I/O REQUEST FOR RTA MODULE IN RAS TABLE      * 72018034
                                  17062+*         CCB      USER CCB                                           * 72024034
                                  17063+*         RASFLAGS RAS FLAGS IN THE RAS LINKAGE AREA                  * 72180025
                                  17064+*         PUBCHANN CHANNEL ADDRESS IN THE PUB                         * 72270025
                                  17065+*         PUBCSFLG CHANNEL SCHEDULER FLAGS IN THE PUB                 * 72450025
                                  17066+*         STRTIO   SIO ROUTINE IN THE SUPERVISOR                      * 72630034
                                  17067+*         INITSIO  LABEL IN SUPERVISOR TO REISSUE I/O                 * 72720025
                                  17068+*         TRNOFF   LABEL OF RETURN TO I/O INTERRUPT HANDLER           * 72740034
                                  17069+*         TKREQID  TASK ID IN THE CHANNEL QUEUE ENTRY                 * 72770034
                                  17070+*         REQID    REQUESTORS ID IN THE CHANNEL QUEUE ENTRY           * 73020034

00D268 4710 FD66      0D210       17532+         BO    RASSIO1            YES, SIO AGAIN               @D34SDSK 96800534
00D26C 910C 0044      00044       17533+         TM    DEVSTA,CHANEND+DEVEND CHANNEL AND/OR DEVICE END @D34SDSK 96800934
00D270 0778                       17534+         BCR   NZ,R8              YES, GO BACK TO CALLER       @D34SDSK 96801134
00D272 07F5                       17535+         BR    R5                 DO RETRY                     @D34RDSK 96801334


                                  17537+*        ROUTINE TO PERFORM IPL-EXIT FOR RAS                         HL 96801734
00D274 9200 F772      0CC1C       17538+RASIPLR  MVI   LINKFLAG,ZERO .    CLEAR FUNCTION FLAG                   96801934

00D27C 94DF 073A      0073A       17540+         NI    SYSFLAG3,XFF-RASIPLBT RESET RAS-IPL FLAG IN SYSFLAG3  HL 96802334
00D280 94FE 0851      00851       17541+         NI    RASFLAGS,XFF-RTAIOA  RESET RAS I/O ACTIVE FLAG  @DA08988 96802434
                            05ED8 17542+         USING DISP,R6                                         @DM05356 96803334
00D284 47F0 6000      05ED8       17543+         B     DISP               RETURN TO USER               @DM05356 96803534
                                  17544+         DROP  R6                                              @DM05356 96803734


                                  17546+*              ROUTINE TO RETURN TO CALLING PROGRAM                  HL 96804128
                                  17547+*              THIS IS THE RTA OR THE RTA FETCH ROTINE               HL 96807028
00D288 9520 F772      0CC1C       17548+RTARETRN CLI   LINKFLAG,RASLFTCH .FETCH REQUEST                      HL 96812828
00D28C 4770 FDF0      0D29A       17549+         BNE   RTARETR2 .         NO,NORMAL RETURN TO RTA            HL 96815728

       DOS SUPERVISOR  SGSCVRT SECTOR CONVERT ROUTINE                                                         PAGE   422


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                  17567+***************************************************************         00350030
                                  17568+*                                                             *         00400030
                                  17569+*   ROTATIONAL POSITION SENSING SECTOR CONVERT ROUTINE        *         00450030
                                  17570+*                                                             *         00500030
                                  17571+*FUNCTION                                                     *         00550030
                                  17572+*   THE FUNCTION OF THE SECTOR CONVERT ROUTINE IS TO          *         00600030
                                  17573+*   CALCULATE THE SECTOR VALUE CORRESPONDING TO A RECORD      *         00650030
                                  17574+*   NUMBER ON A ROTATIONAL POSITION SENSING (RPS) TYPE        *         00700030
                                  17575+*   DEVICE.                                                   *         00750030
                                  17576+*                                                             *         00800030
                                  17577+*   FOR FIXED LENGTH RECORDS, IT WILL SUM THE DATA LENGTHS,   *         00850030
                                  17578+*   KEY LENGTHS, AND OVERHEAD LENGTHS OF ALL PREVIOUS         *         00900030
                                  17579+*   RECORDS AND ADD TO IT THE OVERHEAD FOR RECORD ZERO.       *         00950030
                                  17580+*   THIS RESULTS IN THE NUMBER OF BYTES SO FAR USED ON        *         01000030
                                  17581+*   THE TRACK.  THEN MULTIPLYING BY THE NUMBER OF             *         01050030
                                  17582+*   SECTORS PER TRACK AND DIVIDING BY THE TRACK CAPACITY,     *         01100030
                                  17583+*   THE FINAL RESULT WILL BE THE SECTOR VALUE OF THE NEXT     *         01150030
                                  17584+*   RECORD.                                                   *         01200030
                                  17585+*                                                             *         01250030
                                  17586+*   VARIABLE LENGTH RECORDS CANNOT BE DONE SO EASILY.         *         01300030
                                  17587+*   THEREFORE, IT IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE CALLING        *         01350030
                                  17588+*   PROGRAM TO SUPPLY THE NUMBER OF BYTES WRITTEN SO FAR.     *         01400030
                                  17589+*   THE ROUTINE WILL THEN CALCULATE THE OVERHEAD AND          *         01450030
                                  17590+*   EVENTUALLY THE SECTOR VALUE.                              *         01500030
                                  17591+*                                                             *         01550030
                                  17592+*   IF THE CALCULATED SECTOR VALUE EXCEEDS THE POSSIBLE NUMBER*         01552030
                                  17593+*   OF SECTORS ON A TRACK FOR A SPECIFIED DEVICE, X'FF' WILL  *         01554030
                                  17594+*   BE RETURNED IN REGISTER ZERO. IF USED BLINDLY, THE SET    *         01556030
                                  17595+*   SECTOR INSTRUCTION WILL ACT AS A NO-OP DUE TO THE X'FF'.  *         01558030
                                  17596+*                                                             *         01560030
                                  17597+*   THE SECTOR VALUE IS RETURNED IN REGISTER ZERO.            *         01600030
                                  17598+*                                                             *         01650030
                                  17599+*ENTRY POINTS                                                 *         01700030
                                  17600+*        SECTCAL  -  IF CALLED VIA AN SVC 75                  *         01750030
                                  17601+*        SCVRTBAL -  IF ENTERED VIA A BAL FROM FETCH OR       *         01800030
                                  17602+*                    PAGE MANAGER                             *         01850030
                                  17603+*                                                             *         01900030
                                  17604+*INPUT                                                        *         01950030
                                  17605+*   R10  -  CONTAINS ADDRESS OF PIB (IF CALLED BY SVC).       *         02000030
                                  17606+*   R6   -  CONTAINS EXIT ADDRESS IF CALLED BY SVC            *         02050030
                                  17607+*   R7   -  RETURN REGISTER IF ENTERED BY BAL                 *         02100030
                                  17608+*   R9   -  CONTAINS BASE ADDRESS FOR THIS ROUTINE            *         02150030
                                  17609+*   R0   -  PARAMETER REGISTER (IF ENTERED BY SVC CALL        *         02200030
                                  17610+*           PARAMETERS ARE ADDRESSED IN USER SAVE AREA AS     *         02250030
                                  17611+*           POINTED TO BY PIBSAVE)                            *         02300030
                                  17612+*   R1   -  PARAMETER REGISTER ( SAME AS FOR R0)              *         02350030
                                  17613+*           IF ENTERED BY BAL, ALSO CONTAINS BASE FOR THIS    *         02360030
                                  17614+*           ROUTINE.                                          *         02370030
                                  17615+*                                                             *         02400030
                                  17616+*OUTPUT                                                       *         02450030
                                  17617+*   R0   -  SECTOR VALUE (IF ENTERED BY SVC CALL, THIS        *         02500030
                                  17618+*           VALUE IS STORED AT REG 0 POSITION OF USER         *         02550030
                                  17619+*           SAVE AREA.  SUPERVISOR EXIT ROUTINE WILL PUT      *         02600030
                                  17620+*           IT IN R0)                                         *         02650030
                                  17621+*   ALL OTHER REGISTERS REMAIN UNCHANGED.                     *         02700030

       DOS SUPERVISOR  SGSCVRT SECTOR CONVERT ROUTINE                                                         PAGE   423


  LOC  OBJECT CODE    ADDR1 ADDR2  STMT   SOURCE STATEMENT                      DOS/VS ASSEMBLER REL 34.0 14.38 77-05-09

                                  17622+*                                                             *         02750030
                                  17623+*EXTERNAL REFERENCES                                          *         02800030
                                  17624+*        NONE                                                 *         02850030
                                  17625+*                                                             *         02900030
                                  17626+*EXITS NORMAL                                                 *         02950030
                                  17627+*        EXIT    - VIA REG 6 IF CALLED BY SVC                 *         03000030
                                  17628+*        R7      - REGISTER RETURN IF ENTERED BY BAL          *         03050030
                                  17629+*                                                             *         03100030
                                  17630+*EXITS ERROR                                                  *         03150030
                                  17631+*        NONE                                                 *         03200030
                                  17632+*                                                             *         03250030
                                  17633+*TABLES/WORK AREAS                                            *         03300030
                                  17634+*   DDT      - DEVICE TABLE ENTRIES                           *         03350030
                                  17635+*   SCVRTP   - USER SAVE AREA MAP                             *         03400030
                                  17636+*   SCVRTSV  - REG 8 SAVE AREA                                *         03450030
                                  17637+*   SCVRTSV5 - REG 0 TO 5 SAVE AREA IF ENTERED BY BAL         *         03500030
                                  17638+*                                                             *         03550030
                                  17639+*ATTRIBUTES                                                   *         03600030
                                  17640+*        REUSABLE, PRIVILEGED, DISABLED                       *         03650030
                                  17641+*                                                             *         03700030
                                  17642+*NOTES                                                        *         03750030
                                  17643+*                                                             *         03800030
                                  17644+***************************************************************         03850030
                                  17645+***************************************************************         05950030
                                  17646+*        ENTRY FROM SVC CALL                                  *         06000030
                                  17647+*          REGISTER 10  - ADDRESS OF PIB                      *         06050030
                                  17648+*          REGISTER  6  - EXIT ADDRESS                        *         06100030
                                  17649+*                                                             *         06150030
                                  17650+*        INPUT PARAMETER IN PIB SAVE AREA                     *         06200030
                                  17651+***************************************************************         06250030
00D2DC 189D                       17652+SECTCAL  LR    R9,RD                   LOAD BASE REGISTER      @D34RDFG 06300034
                            0D2DC 17653+         USING SECTCAL,R9              SET ADDRESSABILITY               06350030
00D2DE 47F0 9022      0D2FE       17654+         B     SCVRT00                 GO TO SVC CALL ENTRY             06400030


                                  17656+***************************************************************         06500030
                                  17657+*        ENTRY FROM BAL CALL                                  *         06550030
                                  17658+*          REGISTERS 0 AND 1 CONTAIN INPUT PARAMETERS         *         06600030
                                  17659+*          REGISTER 7  -  EXIT ADDRESS                        *         06650030
                                  17660+*          REGISTERS 1 TO 5 ARE SAVED AT END OF THIS ROUTINE  *         06700030
                                  17661+*                                                             *         06750030
                                  17662+*        NO INTERRUPTS ARE CAUSED, SO ROUTINE CANNOT BE RE-   *         06800030
                                  17663+*          -ENTERED BY SYSTEM TASKS                           *         06850030
                                  17664+*                                                             *         06900030
                                  17665+*        NO INSTRUCTIONS MUST BE INSERTED BETWEEN LABELS      *         06950030
                                  17666+*          SECTCAL AND SCVRTBAL UNLESS THE BAL MECHANISMS     *         07000030
                                  17667+*          IN FETCH AND PAGE MANAGER ARE ALTERED.  THEY ENTER *         07050030
                                  17668+*          THIS ROUTINE VIA WHAT IS EFFECTIVELY A             *         07100030
                                  17669+*                    B     SECTCAL+4                          *         07150030
                                  17670+***************************************************************         07200030
                            0D2E2 17671+SCVRTBAL EQU   *                                                        07250030

                            0D2DC 17673+         USING SECTCAL,R1              FROM A BAL VIA R1                07265030
00D2E2 9089 10E8            0D3C4 17674+         STM   R8,R9,SCVRTSV           SAVE REGS 8 AND 9                07272530
00D2E6 1891                       17675+         LR    R9,R1                   GET RIGHT BASE REG9              07280030

                            0D2DC 17677+         USING SECTCAL,R9              GET ADDRESSABILITY               07295030

                                  17728+***************************************************************         09450030
